on't mistake this game for an FPS some people enter into this game expecting COD ...it's not. ARMA is a full battlefield simulator which it does well at. In ARMA you're not meant to feel invincible if you don't take cover you'll die if you don't communicate with your squad you'll die. It has an insane learning curve that will take most people a long time to get used to but only makes it very satisfying once you finally figure out how to fly or use artillery or...anything. The complicated controls at first can seem annoying but once you're used to them you'll be grateful you can stick your head up just enough to see an enemy out of a window without exposing your whole body.  The games mod-ability makes it possible to play an infinite array of game modes making it difficult to get truly boring. While there is a battlefield like mod called king of the hill the size of the maps alone makes the game vastly more complex and that's saying nothing of the array of vehicles that can completely alter the game from just one player knowing how to fly or range a sniper rifle.   Unfortunately the ARMA engine is well known for how glitchy it can get Most of this has been ironed out and the presence of hackers ruining servers has been greatly reduced since early access. At times clipping through a wall or falling through the floor of a building still happens but it's not so common that it ruins things.  At the end of the day the game requires being patient and on your toes while communicating what you see with teammates. The different mods and game modes give the game infinite potential but the glitches can create issues sometimes.  is a military sim not 'insert FPS here' don't get attached to scores and if you find yourself complaining over global that someone using a plane is 'cheap' or a 'noob' close the game and reevaluate who you want to be in life.10

hen I first played ArmAII I barely enjoyed the game nor did I stay for too long simply because I didn't like it. Coming to ArmAIII I felt a whole different experience a new environment like never before. Something attracted me to this game when I first played it during a free weekend
column2: a feeling of excitement fear and all sorts of emotions of that nature. I felt like a real soldier in an actual militaristic environment. Months later when I actually bought it I got hooked again with the same elements as before. Here are some of the pros and cons after a good 15 hours on the game:  Pros: -Somewhat real life experience (i.e. running (actual stamina system based on how much weight you carry) driving aiming and firing etc.) -Weaponry (Different types of ammo explosives range from mines to grenades Launchers etc). -Amazing Teamwork -Vehicles -Both a Third Person Shooter AND a First Person Shooter  Cons: -Unstable FPS issues (literally stay away from this game if you don't have a strong CPU since this game mainly focuses on more CPU power than GPU) that vary depending on either campaign or multiplayer. I seem to run better on multiplayer for some odd reason but sometimes it's the same as single player on certain occasions such as driving. You literally have to deal with it. The lowest FPS I get on Ultra Settings with a Nvidia GTX 770 and i7 4770k is around 30 tops maybe a good 25 sometimes (like I said when doing various tasks).  -Unreal Physics at certain times. So basically let's say you climb a 5 foot ladder inside a building and fall or you leap from a 1.5 foot distance from a flight of stair in general. Picture the size of 5 feet. That's 60 inches. Jumping from this distance= death. Yup. And even a slight bump from the rear of a car can kill a player (around a 10-15 mph car can kill a player in this). These are some small things to overlook by BI but still I face palm sometimes at the unreality of the physics. -Difficult controls. It took me some time to learn all of the controls and almost 5 minutes to figure out how to aim down the sights. Simple things like these can easily be overlooked but are for sure some of the things to know when coming into ArmA. It ain't easy to get into like Call of Duty or Battlefield.  Neutral Comments: -One last thing to say is that this game can be a running simulator at times. Although you have to travel far distances sometimes on foot (and waste a good amount of time) the game provides a lush realistic environment that contributes the beauty of nature. It compensates for all the running that has to be done but allows you to explore the wilderness of a massive island.  All in all this is my review for the game.   TL

aving played ArmA 2 for almost two years before  came out I had high expectations for . Now Before I get into specifics about the game I have to say  is one of the best games you can get without having to buy any DLC to enjoy a full experience.  is an amazing first person shooter that involves a bit of strategy to win. Whether it means inserting into an enemy camp via SDV or hiking it across altis just to take an enemy helicopter for a spin You have to come up with a plan to have a successful mission. Now  isn't just about objectives and killing virtual entities. ArmA is about a massive multiplayer community made up of players Mod Makers Scripters Cinematics Creators and many more. If you think vanilla has an extremely large amount of content Wait til you get a look at all of the mods and missions created by just the player base.   Pros  Extremely fun and adrenaline pumping gameplay Crazy amounts of mods available Extremely large and diverse player base Very well made models and objects High end graphics Not very many hackers Large amount of servers to choose from Lots of updates  Cons  Physics can sometimes be a bummer when attempting unusual missions or actions Can be hard to run for some people Can be a little hard to learn how to play Again Physics  Overall I give  a 10/10. This game has exceeded my expectations. I can replay this game everyday for a week and still not want to put it down. If you are looking for a first person shooter that involves a crazy amount of strategy and content This is the game for you.10

his game....Ooooh this game...Is amazing. It's a first/third person realistic tactical shooter. If you are a person who plays Call Of Duty and think you can run into a room witha sniper rifle and 'G37 Th053 SW33T YY360QuIcKS20p3S 1adDerSTA1ls' then this game is really not for you. The campain is 'meh' but the multiplayer is where the fun comes in you have Altis life a sort of rpg gamemode Patrol Ops (My favorite) where you look for enemy encampments or chemicals and deal with them teamdeathmatch and tons of others. If you have played previous ArmA games you will know that the controls are a bit...odd...Well in  they are still kinda odd but they are better. There is an entirely new mechanic in 3 called the 'stance system.' Basically if you are standing you have four different poses that can help with almost each and every situation same goes for the four crouching and four prone. There is a decent range of weapons and atachments and no limit to clothing options.  The one big and noticable problem with Arma...is it's optimization...The game doesn't run well on some systems for seemingly no reason.10

est military sandbox out there. This is not just a game. he interface allthough improved can still be overwhelming. I don't know how many times I have reloaded my weapon when I wanted to open a door or how many times I have thrown a grenade when I wanted to look in my backpack. It doesn't help that Bohemia changes the default keys for every installation of ARMA. However this can be changed to your preferences of course. Another factor to consider is that it is HEAVY on your computer. Make no mistake about this if you want to view all the bling-bling it has to offer. It seems that it's terribly hard for Bohemia to optimise their engines. This is true from the first Operation Flashpoint to DayZ SA. You need spend some TLC on the options to make it run smooth and even with a beast of computer ARMA3 can bring it to it's knees without sweating.   With all this said I have played all the ARMA games in the hundreds of hours per installment. And except for Operation Flashpoint which had an excellent campain mode the single player is not the reason for why I come back. Quite frankly they might as well have left it out.  No it's in the multiplayer mode (being Wasteland Life Zombie Nation or just a regular all out war session) that it really shines. It defines sandbox fun. Rarely does a game cause so much emotions and I frequently end up sharing 'warstories' with colleagues and friend. It has the feature of drawing you into the gameplay and no other game gives me sweaty palms like the Arma-series.  So if you are prepared to spend some time to learn the game you will have a gem that litterally has a mod for anything you can think of. Kill zombies? Sure. Want some stealth play? Sure. Want to live your life as a drugbaron? Of course. Want some chaotic all out tank/air/land battles? Definitely.   And if it doesn't have what you can dream up you can always create your own content.10

is an excellent game  and one of those games I keep returning to after playing something else for a while. For anyone interested in realistic combat games this game ticks all the boxes and is definitely worth the cost. I think it’s also worth a quick mention that when buying this game you are not only buying into a combat simulator with a ten hour campaign. Upon purchasing this game you will have access to a staggering amount of (very engaging high quality) community generated content that will keep you playing for a very long time.   It’s difficult to point a finger at the exact features that for me makes this game stand out among a mountain of other games. However for the sake of this review I’m going to point out a few of the details that keep me coming back for more.    1. The game itself  This is a very good combat simulator. Obviously it’s nothing like putting your boots on and heading into a real conflict zone. It is however everything I want and expect from a modern combat game. The graphics are great the audio is great and the primary storyline is interesting. This game is also huge giving you lots of room to play around with the tools you are given and going about things in your own way. The AI is fairly good for a game of this size as well. In certain situations (inside buildings for instance) the AI doesn’t perform very well but overall the AI is a good friend to have and a dangerous enemy to have shooting at you. This game is basically a playground and a toolbox. You’re given a huge area to play around in and the tools you need to have fun.    2. The user generated content  Done with the main game? At the point where most games would have you restart the game and try this gun instead of that one for the exact same results? No worries – in  you have hundreds of hours of user generated content to play with. There’s a lot of exceptional community created content out there and some of it even rivals the main campaign in quality and fun. The user generated content is where this game shines the most and where you will get the most out of your well spent cash.    3. The Editor  The editor. What to say about the editor? If you like combat games and you are a creative type the editor alone is probably going to be worth your money. The editor is probably also where most of my registered play time has been spent.  The ability to create any scenario you can think of on any number of different maps is great. Create any kind of mission any kind of conflict and play it. Have you made something cool? Great! Release it on Steam Workshop and allow other people to play it too. In a lot of other games I find myself wishing that the missions were a bit different or wondering what would happened if this or that happened. In a lot of other game your thoughts are left to die as the awful story rumbles on. In  you can simply jump into the editor and create the scenarios and situations you find interesting and see what happens. I love the Editor and when I say I keep coming back to the game I really mean that I keep coming back to the Editor to create more scenarios and missions.    Cons of the game.   Yes. This game has cons. Yes there are things that could have been better. However if you’re already a fan of these kinds of games you are probably already aware that the AI is still not a challenge for the human mind. You will be aware of the limits involved in such a huge game.  I have spent a lot of time playing this game and in all that time I have barely noticed any of these problems at all. Because of this I don’t really feel that these hiccups are rally worth a mention. They won’t hamper your enjoyment of the game in any way and should definitely not have any say in whether you get this game or not. Besides if you’re really into reading about the downsides there are plenty of other reviewers detailing them.    To finish this review  I think that I’ll simply say that any one of my points above are worth the price of the game. Each of these points will give you far more enjoyment than a lot of other more expensive games will give you in their lifetime. If you want my opinion and you obviously do you should definitely get this game if you are into realistic combat games.10

y far one of my favourite games!  I've been playing Arma since the good ol' OFP series and have truly enjoyed each new addition to the Armaverse. That being said the game and series are not without its faults. Luckily the faults are often overshadowed by the large modding community which in my opinion is one of the best communities out there. Kudos to the devs for creating a game that encourages modding. If it's not in the game yet you can be almost certain that someone will mod it in.  If you like milsim or just want to upgrade to something more tactical and realistic than the COD or BF-series well give Arma a try. Initially the game might seem confusing but with the introduction of Bootcamp new players are guided through the basics of the game and get a chance to test their skills before taking on the full Arma experience.  A lot of players play the games single player campaign before embarking on what truly makes Arma great the multiplayer experience. You'll find a large number of Arma groups all looking for new members and no matter what you prefer be it Marines Special Forces or Insurgents there's bound to be a group for you too.  Some of the drawbacks about  is that it's set in a not to distant future and thus the developers have chosen to 'futurefy' the units and vehicles. Some like it some don't. In previous installations of Arma the conflict areas somewhat resembled ongoing conflict areas in the real world whereas in A3 the conflict initially takes place in the Mediterranean and covers a conflict between CSAT (Iran and others) and NATO. The island of Altis does look great though and offers plenty of space for combined warfare. If anything it lacks a bit of forest.  One of the higlights of the game to me is the editor. Anyone who's played with LEGO as a child will love the editor. It gives you the chance to create your own missions and the possibilities seem endless from the easy and short missions to the vastly complex ones that require a good amount of scripting. Arma has it all! Plus with Eden coming along the editor is about to get even more awesome. A full featured 3D editor so no more guessing if you've placed the units at the correct spot or if they're facing the right window etc. Eden delivers big time improvements over the 'classic' 2D editor.  Now I could go on for ages with this review but essentially here are my thoughts on the game if you're thinking of buying it.  Buy it: - If you like to play in a more tactical manner than COD/BF - If you like being a part of a massive community where something new is always being modded in - If you can live with some of the small errors and restrictions by the game-engine and realizing that the game is under constant development - If you like large scale combined warfare - If you have ever played with LEGO and enjoy creating stuff - If you're looking to get into an Arma group and anjoying the MP community - If you want a game that you can play for ages  Don't buy it: - If you think it's anything like COD/BF/CS:GO - If you think you'll learn the game in 30 minutes - If you can't live with AI that sometimes is  - If you have a low spec PC (Arma is horrendously optimized as of yet and your FPS WILL drop)10

ne of the most challenging and satisfying games ever made I can not praise the ArmA series enough in general and  is the pinnacle of how good a military simulator can be. The learning curve is steep and at first you will be frustrated but if you have the patience to learn and master the technical aspects of the game it rewards you with an experience you simply can't find anywhere else.  Add on to this the mod support with new game modes weapons vehicles missions and so much more this is a game that keeps on giving.10
Epoch. Should I say more?

n infinite playground. Feel like some competition play? Boot up multiplayer and hop on Wasteland or TDM matches. Scenario play? Join one of the massive missions kicking around online. Extremely cool and unique singleplayer experiences? Hop on Steam Workshop and get one of the top rated missions. Want to goof around with your friends? Fire up a co-op mission. There's no game that offers you this much flexibility and this much room to stretch out in.  If you're an ArmA vet you know this already. Unlike the previous ArmA games though despite some bugs it's not completely inaccessible to the public. The server system is incredibly easy to use. Steam integration is fantastic. The player models and controls don't feel like operating heavy machinery (except when you're operating heavy machinery). Infantry controls are fluid. Helicopters take time to master but are a joy once you do. Tanks and armored vehicles are appropriately weighty (if a little low on torque and climbing power at times... I often wish I had manual gearboxes).  Play ArmA III. You'll have a lot of fun.10

h where to begin with ....   I had just landed on a beach in a rubber boat with my four man team. We are assaulting enemy positions to capture intel and eliminate a HVT. Soon after landing we are ambushed by an enemy assault boat that promply decimates my team. I manage to land a rocket hit on the boat and incapacitate its crew before it can annihilate me. With the boat disabled I am now on my own. Do I continue the mission by myself or do I abort and let my team die for nothing? I choose to continue using a silenced weapon to help conceal my position. I call for friendly reinforcments to begin the assault on the town. A convoy with friendly troops starts coming down the road. Suddenly rockets from a hilltop position begin to rain down on the convoy disabling several vehicles. Everyone dismounts and begins engaging the enemy on the hilltop. I use the distraction to flank the enemy position and eliminate the fireteam. We proceed towards the town eliminating small pockets of resistance along the way. Suddenly we are pinned down by enemy machinegun fire that kills several friendlies. I call in an airstrike that levels the houses containing the position eliminating the threat along with the HVT. I then see a target of opportunity: an enemy cargo truck. I align my sights slightly above the target to compensate for the distance and fire. The truck erupts into flames. This came at a price as my postion was compromised and drew heavy enemy fire towards my position. We have no choice but to engage. After several bloody minutes four enemy fireteams lay dead on the battlefield with only light casualties on our side. I decide this is the moment to assault the position containing the intel. I successfully acquire the intel and call in an evac chopper to extract me to a safe position. We extract under fire and secure the intel dealing a severe blow to the enemy.  10/1010

Where do I begin?  ARMA the top game for being the only realistic war simulator sadly it makes you enjoy it but hey virtual reality is for that no?  ARMA does give you this expierience where you fear a bullet where flanking smokes aiming actually matters I have missed so many shots for not adjusting my zeroing or not thinking about bullet drop since you get a panic reaction shot.  I have been in a ARMA unit which taught me the basics like using the compass bearing for pointing out objects enemies tactics and callsigns. I would say the game is best for the unit deal since that way this game is pushed to its true meaning.  We have ARMA life or so called 'Altis Life' which esentially is a roleplay quite weird and difficult but if you get used to it you will enjoy it as well  The game is well optimised but there are certain glitches through it I have to be honest I don't kind of like how the movement feels limited but you get used to it and with some new things added it feels more solid. In conclusion the game is well made not the best maybe but still this is something better then your CoD

Hello  Let me start this out by saying I myself have played 1372 hours of this game from the date of this review.  or Armed Assault 3 is a sandbox military simulation.  has a variety of game-modes ranging from Invade and Annex (A more objective based team oriented game-mode) Altis Life (A game-mode that is basically well... life you can buy cars houses boats guns etc. You can have many jobs such as Police Officer Rebel Drug Lord or anything of your imagination really.) Wasteland (A more survival based game-mode where you can team up with friends or other players to survive complete objectives earn money kills others and buy equipment) Along with a variety of other modded gamemodes ranging from Milsim type game-modes to more casual game-modes. If you are into any sort of military simulation survival or roleplaying type games you should definently give  a shot especially with the new Steam refund policy so you can try it for up to 2 hours and if you like it keep it. Now is it worth the $60 dollars? For me it is well worth your $60 as I got a lot more out of this game than any normal priced $60 game. Now for the DLC that is totally up to you as you can play on any server and even ride and even sometimes pick up the DLC content it does not separate the community at all. Though depending on your system hardware the game may be very hard to run though with some tweaks found in forums and videos it can improve your framerate by a lot. To sum it up  is a great game for what is it.  - TooSpooky

column2: is simply the best tactical shooter available to the general public at this time.  9.5/10  If you want a realistic virtual platform to practise and test real-world military tactics this is the one. Plug in TrackIR or Oculus rift and you'll soon be working harder than you have in your life to move your squad 20m deeper into a heavily defended enemy town whilst your attached armed personell carriers volley in suppressive fire from the elevated position you stationed them 1 km South. And when you need those APC's to prioritize their fire onto an enemy weapons squad that's pinning you down issue the order and they will comply.  On a less serious note if you want a great multiplayer combined-arms experience which feels less 'gamey' than the generic FPS this will also satisfy you. Want an fast-paced urban-combat experience where real skill is rewarded and spray and pray is punished? This is it.  In reality ARMA is somewhat difficult to compare to anything else available because there is nothing else with the level of detail that ARMA has when it comes to weapon models ballistics wounding systems (in ARMA there are memory locations for each major bone in the human body which means you can break your lower arm bone upper arm bone lower leg bone e.t.c.) AI material penetration (walls do not stop large rounds) and the maps are pretty huge. 270km squared is bigger than a lot of real-world cities and often having a skilled pilot who can get your squad to the combat area using the terrain as cover so as to avoid lockon by enemy AA missiles will be the difference between a win and a loss. ARMA is actually not even a video game in many sense. It's more a realistic training tool which can be played as a game.  Teamplay. Nothing like it. Struggle together or die alone. The level of danger and lethality in the ARMA series has always promoted teamwork and cooperation leading to incredibly satisfying experiences where you and friends and sometimes total strangers will overcome staggering odds. The combat medic drags a wounded teammate out of an open killzone. He's taking fire. The wounded man remembers to give his contact report - he saw muzzle flash from an enemy weapon 0.2 seconds before he went down and he knows to use muzzle velocity to calculate the distance
column3: 'In the building two-hundred-and-fifty-meters to the North. First floor.' His radio goes silent. He has passed out from a combination of blood loss and shock. You realise the passed out man is your teamleader so you assume command ordering your machinegunner and grenadier to direct heavy fires into the first floor windows and smoke grenades in front of the enemy position to suppress and reduce the accuracy of the enemy shooter keeping your medic from catching 2 lethal 7.62 rounds in the torso. The enemy shooter is determined and smart. He's moved back in the room and is firing through a sliver of window. He knows your machinegunner doesn't know exactly where he is. The fire is still coming in. The enemy shooter hits the window rim and the round deflects way off target. His next shot is interrupted by a hail of incoming rounds from your teams machinegunner
column4: blind-fire still kills but after ducking for a moment the shooter is back on target. As he aims he is shook by a 40mm grenade exploding on the exterior of his building but he knows high explosive ain't getting through a concrete wall and an enemy medic is a prize target. His weapon raises... Your medic is only 25 meters from cover now but that might as well be a mile. Dragging a 90kg man along with a combined total of 50kg of weapons and equipment is slowing his movement substantially. You know if your medic goes down it's game over. Your team will scramble to treat the two men become combat-ineffective and be surrounded and killed in that construction site. You know you can't go to help him because the first rule of infantry combat is use cover and don't get shot - the last thing your team needs is two men wounded instead of one. You know your machinegunner doesn't have an exact target and with the amount of fire he's putting down he'll be lucky to hit anything. You know 40mm high explosive grenades don't penetrate concrete walls... It seems like the medic will go down soon. Surely the enemy machinegunner will deploy and deliver grazing fire across the field in a matter of seconds cutting down everything under two meters for a long long way including your medic. You lean out and blindly fire to the North feeling in the back of your mind that the mission will soon fail. Unless... Suddenly you hear a single shot from a rifle. It sounds very different to the machinegun fire that has been crackling for the past 10 seconds. A second shot a moment later. Looking over your left shoulder you see a trail of smoke disappating around a tree about 30 meters behind your position. The smoke is from the business end of the rifle of your teams designated marksman. 'Enemy marksman neutralized North building first floor. Enemy machinegunner neutralized West corner of that building' he says on the radio. Enemy fire starts coming in from the North-West but its sporadic and innacurate
column5: the enemy squad is trying to keep you pinned whilst it reorganizes after having lost its long range and volume-fire capabilities but those rounds are being deflected by the wind and they're landing way off target. You calculate from the delay between impact and report that it's from over 600 meters out. Your marksman reports on the radio again
column6: 'Engaging enemy rifleman. 550 meters North-North-West'. You smile watching your medic treat your teamleader both now in cover. Your marksman will be on the radio again soon you feel...  Another amazing thing about  is its versatility
column7: you can load up almost any scenario imaginable and jump right in - there's a reason the militaries of the world use software from the same development house to train real-world troops.  The level of support from the developers is also unparallelled. At the time of this review it's 2 years after release date and they are about to release the 2nd of 3 major updates which add massive value to the game and they do it free.  500 000 Euro's prize money to the people who develop the best content for ? Yes. And what great content it has been. Years of campaigns and multiplayer gamemodes and thousands of kilometers of official and community terrains.  In short it's the best realistic military simulator with more gamemodes than you could imagine and more than 1000 square kilometers of map to run swim drive fly and most of all strategize on in around through and above.  If your interest in or studies of military procedures and tactics is urging you to test your mettle  is the place to do it. I even know some real-world soldiers who train with friends on the ARMA platform.  Do it.

ased on a true experience...   My friend Kevin one random solider on our team and I hopped into an attack helicopter. Kevin piloted us towards the daunting airbase that was invested with opposing fighters. From high up in the sky we saw tiny dots of soldiers moving about alongside menacing tanks. The sound of explosions pierced the early morning air as we flew. Shrouds of fire illuminated the sky. We were attempting to rendezvous with our other teammates when...all of a sudden an alarm broke out in our helicopter. A missile was headed right toward us. As soon as the missile hit our perception of sound was overwhelmed with whirling wind and explosions. We had to make an emergency exit parachuting to the dangerous battlefield below...    10/1010

have spent a good amount of time in this game both singleplayer and multiplayer. And I have to say this game can literally become any game you want. = Obviously  is built for epic tactical action gameplay. The base game involves around military atmosphere: tanks attack jets attack boats armored cars soldiers and helicopters
column2: all of those can be accessed right away after you purchase the game and install it. = The game has many complicated systems and machanics such as commanding the AIs (it's a real pain in the butt) seats in vehicles stances movements interaction menu etc. This is why many new players feel disencouraged and quit playing the game. But if you are a tough gamer and able to deal with difficulties then this game might be for you. = As I said earlier you can experience this game in unlimited number of ways with or without mods. Mods play a big role in the game but I will say about that later. = Without mods the player can still join several multiplayer servers both PVP and PVE which has different gamemodes too. But if you want to play singleplayer this game can serves you well too. = Singleplayer in this game has 3 forms: campaign scenarios and editor. -Campaign is pretty much self-explainatory. You play as a soldier on the island with your fellow army teammates and go on an adventure with wide-open levels and a simple set of story. You can play the original  base game's campaign or the ones you download from Steamworkshop (or others) which are user-created and some of them are really enjoyable to try out. -Scenarios are short  missions that usually made by  players and can be downloaded from the Steamworkshop (or other  community websites) Some of them are really enjoyable like custom campaigns. -Editor is a very powerful tool in . In this mode you can create your own mission in any style you like. as long as you know how to do it. I suggest going through the  editor guides and  community websites to learn more about the editor. = MODS Mods are the wheels that keep this game running. There are countless of them and a lot of them can improve your overall experience in the game some can change the game completely. For example the mod 'Altis Life' is a multiplayer total conversion mod. It features the role-playing multiplayer experience from normal civilians to police forces and outlaws. Therefore even if you prefer a role-playing multiplayer game you can play this game just with mods. But if you are here to be a soldier on the battlefield fighting bad guys with fellow soldiers you also have a lot of windows for modding. Weapon mods vehicle mods faction mods etc. can be downloaded via Steamworkshop (and other websites) to add unlimited variety of reallistic content to the game. = MilSim MilSim stands for Military Simulation which in the context of this game is a style of gameplay that involves around serious and reallistic gameplay. Every player will act like a real life soldier and work together as a team. Usually MilSim servers have mods to make the game more challenging and reallistic and admins of the servers or the head of the army will only pick players who are old enough and can play appropriately in their servers. So far MilSim gameplay is the most accurate experience that  is trying to offer to the players. = Thank you for reading the review. I have to manage all the mods and watch some editor tutorials.10

imulation isn't the defining aspect of Arma. It's scale.  The enormity of the map is the foundation for the experiences that distinguish Bohemia Interactive's flagship franchise. It's what makes radios topographical maps binoculars and compasses practical equipment in an FPS. It's what allows for kilometer-long headshots and coordinated convoy raids. It's what makes using your eyes to spot hints of enemies--muzzle flashes tracers gunsmoke--as valuable as being a crack shot. 10

ell as most have probably said this game has almost complete limitations. You can fly a helicopter on your own or join a police department in some advanced roleplay communities. This game could be considered a 'simulator' to some but to those who play it understand what it is a game where you can literally do what you want. Mod support through the community is amazing and the servers are pretty great aswell.   As for singleplayer I have not touched it once. I played the singleplayer within Arma 2 the previous version of this game was not the best thing in the world. The communities for this game are endless as I said previously there are vast online communities that are based on roleplay such as Critical Gaming but also communities that are more based in hard-core military roleplay which use radio-codes coordinates and more militaristic banter these are communities such as Shack Tactical.  Another cool this? If you do not understand the game on how to do specific things check out the steam workshop! You can find mission style tutorials on there where you may find yourself very interested. It has limitless possibilites.   Now that I have said all the things good about it let's get to the cons and yes this game has a few. Graphics you do not need a beefy grapahics card although it does help. You need a good CPU though as this game basis almost all of it's functions off of the CPU. You can adjust your settings which will help in some cases but alot of times not in others. Errors are a common thing if you are interested in mods if not you should be good. bought this game a couple of weeks ago when it was on 50% off sale mostly because I run native linux and wasn't sure how well the 'Experimental Beta' was going to run on my rig. My fellow Linux users told me how well it ran so I figured I'd support Virtual Programming's effort by getting  and hoping everything ran fine.  Pros:  It runs more than fine it runs 55-62fps with mostly standard settings. 100% stable for me thus far no freezes crashes or other bugs at all. With over 15 hours into the game (mostly single-player campaign but several in multiplayer with other Linux-users) I can honestly say I have not run into any functional issues thus far.  As for gameplay well I suggest you watch some gameplay videos on youtube if you're on the fence. This isn't a casual pick-up shooter you play for 20-30 min and go back to work. It's so immersive and in-depth that's because it is a tactical combat simulation more than just a shooter. The replayability seems limitless and I can see why a lot of reviewers have thousands of hours of gameplay into this.  Cons:  For the Linux client there is no official support (yet) and there has not been made any announcements that there ever will be any release from Beta. That's cool I like what Virtual Programming is doing and I'd like to support their effort (and help convince Bohemia Interactive that Linux Gamers are Gamers too and our money is money too).  As such there is no game-launcher making running steam workshop mods very difficult. I mean I've figured out how to change launch properties but it's hard to find out the correct launch-tag name/syntax for each mod and really I'm having plenty of fun with the Vanilla game (for now) but would hope that Bohemia comes to the descision to plan for official Linux/SteamOS release (after all Steam Machines are about a month away from full release!). So really this is only a con for Linux-gamers (at the moment) but not having a functional launcher makes running mods extremely hard.  The only other con I can think of thus far is the AI. It seems pretty shallow and I could be wearing a full ghillie suit proned out under a pile of bushes and trees and tall grass and an enemy soldier half a click away sees my thumb protruding from a branch in 1/4 of a second and 360 no-look jumping headhoots me &lt
column2: /hyperbole. At other times I can walk up right behind them have them not notice me as I pull out my pistol and execute them like some contract hit. And let's not get into your friendly AI...sheesh talk about real REMF/POGUE types.  Anyway the AI isn't as bad as I make it sound it's just fairly crude and pretty much the only un-polished part of this game and could use some serious attention.  Final Thoughts:  Beyond that I plan on sinking tons more hours into this game and REALLY hope that Bohemia Interactive throws Virtual Programming a bone on their eON Wrapper (translation layer?)...it works seriously.   Just watch this youtube video for a side-by-side comparison  Linux to Windows:   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nASDQCPjxOg   For Linux gamers currently totally worth it if you can find it for 50% off or more. If it is announced that it will ever exit Experimental Beta and one day Linux will join the official ranks of  support then the full price is more than worth it and the future fun you'll have. Outstanding game been waiting for something like this all my linux-life. column2: don't expect DCS style flying. Helicopters are alright but lacking some versatility. Overall as far as air flight is concerned it’s not bad at all the feeling of being inside a chopper and seeing your fellow soldiers mount in is great. In regards to maps there is a HUGE land mass to play on you can also download extra maps. Making your own missions is very easy you can setup some great CO-OP scenarios against the NPC or other players. The game features the ability to mount mods there is a great variety from Exile to Altis Life there is allot of options outside of original ARMA and its set gameplay. Multiplayer servers are generally very full and there are allot of different types of maps and styles to choose from. If you want a very detailed and solid purchase game then this is a great buy. Infantry styled game play is really realistic great scopes range of guns (especially with APEX) and you feel like an actual soldier going into battle.  The only down sides that I see are to do with the mechanics of the engine. Like I mentioned before I would've liked better airplane mechanics and physics same with helicopters. The engine itself isn't ultra-fluent it's very 'sim like' so don’t expect “Call of Duty” styled gameplay. The controls are detailed but once you set them up it makes for great gaming. Lastly to any other old ARMA fans ARMA 2 has a huge amount of assets  is lacking in that department quite significantly. The futuristic take on warfare might not be to everyone’s taste (it certainly didn’t sit well with me).  Overall I would recommend this game it's expensive maybe get it on sale but well worth it. 10

WARNING* Before even considering this game ensure you have a powerful pc. I can barely run 40 fps on medium with an i7 4770 16gb ram and an oc HD7950.   Simple review:  Pros: -Environment is amazing -Gameplay is extremely realistic (expect one shot kills from an AR)  -Srategy must be utilised to gain results -The addition of the workshop is what really makes it shine (mods scenarios weapon addons and much more!)  -Interesting missions gamemodes and campaign is decent -The difficulty of the game makes it highly rewarding (subjective)  -Mechanics is great from the physics to the UI -A ton of vehicles to learn to use if you run out just go to the workshop -DEFINITELY NOT a fast pace game like COD or BF (subjective)  -I can be here all day listing out the pros as there are so many features   Cons: -Takes a while to get into especially if you haven't played previous Arma games -Frustration and rage is common (especially on hard missions) (subjective)  -UI can be a bit complicated at first and takes getting used to -Large game especially with addons (shouldn't be much of a problem)  -Gameplay takes a long time to adapt to and learning to fly planes and helis well takes ages  Proper review: This game is probably one of the best military game I have ever played. It is far different to your average fps and aims for realism. This means it is not suitable for everyone especially those who love fast paced gameplay and do not want to patiently learn how to play.   It surpasses its predecessor Arma 2 in almost every way. There are significantly LESS BUGS and mechanics UI AIs movement and vehicle control is improved. The misfortunes of getting killed in doors from arma 2 are gone and so are many other issues.  The gameplay is extremely slow and maps are simply massive. The one thing that I find annoying is dying to a sniper after running 2km on foot in a mission. I guess it adds to the realism and when playing singleplayer there is a 4x time lapse button.  Strategising is key and it makes this game even better when playing with friends. You must learn the best ways to clear out buildings find the best angles of attack and you must learn to work as a unit. If your ever going to use those high school geography skills its going to be when you are using the map is this game when finding grid positions finding hills and valleys using contour lines and using the compass.   Weapons and their mechanics are well done. Running makes your gun unstable and requires time for you to steady it when you rest. Guns have extremely high recoil which renders automatic fire almost useless unless you in extreme CQB. Also weapons are loud and the loudness depends on the weapon and if it has a silencer or not. Loudness translates to detection which the game implements perfectly gunshot loudness will disappate the further away you are from the shot which makes it realistic. AIs also detect you at different rates which depends partially on how far you fire your gun from them.   Vehicles are a major aspect of the game and each type of vehicles needs to be learnt how to be used effectively. Land vehicles are quite simple and there should be no trouble for anyone there but air vehicles is where it gets more ticky. They take time to master and must patiently be done. Vehicles range dynamically from suvs with 50cal mounted MGs and tanks to civilian hatch backs and trucks.   Lastly the implementation of the workshop was genius as it made modding extremely easy with a launcher that is simple when disabling and enabling mods without deleting/unsubscribing to them. There are mods which surpass all expectations such as the OPTRE halo mod which adds a ton of content and a weapon pack (I forgot the name) which adds like fifty weapons. The user made scenario missions are very fun to play with friends and difficulty ranges along with the themes of these missions. The mods are essentially unofficial DLCs because of the quality and quantity of thr content they add.  Verdict: All in all I recommend this game to someone who wants to try something new/different and wants to learn how to utilise new mechanics and play with friends.  offers many things that are not present in many games.  9/10 definitely worth the price tag10

.9/10  This game is really a harcore FPS. The moments you get stem from bullets whizzing by as you just entered an ambush! You hear your friends yelling over the mic  JACK IS DEAD! Every encounter is slow and planned and if it gets big enough becomes hectic. It encompasses BF3 and 4 and even some COD aspects of action (much less COD like .05%). The adrenaline rushes when you see an enemy are astounding and get amplified as you understand your utter mortality.  The editor is great and I see amazing potential even full fledged campeigns from users! Albeit it is hard to grasp and understand and requires constant bug testing from the users side to make sure that every trigger etc. work properly. Its as simplified of a complex editor that you can get. Once fully mastered allows for some amazing missions!    The downside is the optiimization when i first got the game and did multi at the lowest setting i was getting 5 or 10 FPS. Now Im getting a solid 30 the Dev team truly listens. I like that they released this fix before they went on with their campeign etc. Since they realized that the community discovered a game breaking issue (kinda discovered they already knew but did not excpect this to affect so many people).    All in all the game mught have its bugs but its a fabulous and hardcore game with an in game editor that's as simple and proffesional as it gets and a dev team that offer full support to thegame and are constantly improving it!  8.9/1010

am very very conflicted while writing this review. I really loved playing . I've had some good times and made some good memmories. And I still havn't even fully explored all the mods that are available! But like I said I'm conflicted. And here's why.   -No Real Solo Play Online   If you plan on playing alone prepare to not have fun. Unless you're a gaming golden god with the reaction speed of a gerbil on speed and the skills of a pro you're going to be  off a lot. Especially in specific mods that pit you against other players (Wasteland etc.) you will get angry. think one of the most incredible factors of this game is that it serves as more of a Base for you to create your own ideal game from. The amount of addons/mods avaliable on Armaholic and on the Workshop allow you to pretty much tune  into whatever type of game you desire be it Survival RPG Real Time strategy Civilian Roleplay e.c.t. the list goes on and on. As do my countless hours playing this game. The majority of my hours have actually been spent within the editor making my own missions.   For people who own Arma 2 and still haven't decided weather to make the jump the new engine while it wasnt greatly optimised or particularly incredible back in early release after constant changes and tweaks as well as enhanced features which come with the DLC's that you dont even need to pay for (you just have to buy the DLC for the actual assets themselves) the engine makes huge improvements in almost every area over the old Arma 2 engine.    Apex itself is a tricky one its a great addon and adds in some interesting new vehicles like the VTOLs which although I dont normally go for the more futuristic style of gameplay they are indeed awesome and most of the assets included in Apex are beautiful quality although the map Tanoa to me has a truly unique vibe with its dense jungles and volcanos e.c.t the map doesn't seem designed with larger scale engagements in mind more of your behind enemy lines recon style missions which is still great of course. But is it worth the money? Well that really falls down to you and what you value in a game.    9.0/10 Apex 7.5/1010

is a great military training game or representational life like army game. There are a few nuts and bolts that need to be tightened and bolted into place but overall it's a phenomenal shooter. It's a first-person and third-person shooter you can interchange what visual aspect you want to be in inside the game. In the campaign you play as Ben Kerry a U.S. Army soldier that is a component of NATO peacekeeping military force. The game and online proceeds in the year two thousand thirty five. The campaign and maps made for the game take place on Aegean islands of Altis (Lemnos) and Stratis of Greece in the Mediterranean Sea. The game itself has many DLCs that you can buy on G_2_A for very cheap(nickel-and-dime) prices. If you have a moderate(regular) computer or PC(Program counter) then this game should run fine around 35-45 frames. If you have a crappy computer or PC then I would suggest sticking to another game. You learn a lot about the military air force delta units and more in the campaign and online. It gets too the point were you start talking like a solider and forget(draw a blank) that it's a game. You can also have large indefinite amounts of fun and dip around with your friends.10

: A triumph of programming this improves on the old in every way looks farking fantastic on a good system Im sure I will spend many many hours exploding incinerating and pink misting bad guys. Slightly more modernistic gear and weapons and the new large map is farking insanely huge. Great job Bohemia!!!!!  - APEX:  I in all my countless of hours playing this series under various names since the year of our lord 2000 have never been so highly impressed with the work done for a single map and cannot I stress CANNOT say enough high praises for the latest campaign that came with the initial APEX release. Particularly the 'Hearts of Darkness' mission.  Pros: -use of lighting is just fantastic mind blowing at times.   -Overall graphics feel well optimized(finally) with continuous 60fps on ultra settings and high vis disance (machine specs at end)  -Again accolades to the lighting team- when used properly its so close to real its staggering  -the preconfigured campaign with it respawn feature make this combat simulator a little freindlier for MP play  -The campaign is well done mechanically that is to say the gameplay missions are fun and challenging with plenty of replayability.  -Added set of new vehicles elements items you name it. Very comprehensive addition of props and other 'life adding' features in the editor.  -In all my years of playing only one other map has shined so brightly in my mind Kunduz Afghanistan. (Mod) This one is better in nearly every regard to all that have come before it especially in the way of textures and sound. Just flying around it is a real treat. Way to go Bohemia!  Cons: -MP mission feels somewhat limited as to loadouts especially by the end. -Its still ARMA so high learning curve for being able to do all the things you need to know how to do. (Once mastered the rewards are amazing.)  -As a fanthing I have a hard time finding cons. Ive made solid friends from this game over the years playing in online communities playing tactical cant be done any better. This game is a true to life military simulator. In fact it is used under a different name for training the military. Being deployed to Afghanistan I literally sat through a theater specific IED threat briefing that was entirely an ARMA video. I was jealous of the units they had to use.

as been playing this game from v1.14 pirated version so my actual hours I spent was more than 15k hours maybe. Bought the legit copy on 2015 worth the full price but I'm just broke lol.   The game itself is basically a sandbox with many potential scenarios and situations the only limits was your imagination and your will. Once you finished the campaign you probably trying any casual gameplay like Wasteland Altis Life Exile etc. Or if you like zombies you might like Breaking Point Exile with Zombies and many variation of them until you don't even know what do you want to play. So much things to do.  Or if you into realism or immersion of military simulation you can join any Unit and play like actual soldier in battlefield following some protocols radio and . It maybe sound so serious but trust me it was fun. There are many things you don't expect to be happen but turns out it was a hilarious experience with your teammates or some dumb acts someone did makes you laugh.  For regular player you might found Arma have complicated action button on the keyboard a lot of it but you will get used to it. And Arma have REALLY BIG maps like dude it was 20km square ! people sometimes joking about it called 'asthmatic jogging simulator' because you will mostly run one to other place very often. even running 1km take a few minutes on foot. But if you playing a scenario mission it wont be matter as long as you put some vehicle in advantage point and keep the immersive gameplay.  what its good about Arma ? its THE MODS. the community keeps growing and there is some awesome authors put their effort and times making cool mods like new maps new weapon and etc. You may ended up having mod running 50gb on your disk.  Lets talk about downside. Some people complaining about its performance on multiplayer like having very low fps although you running a monster pc race. Well basically arma is calculating everything ingame your character the environment weather time bullet trajectory ambient sound animation AI etc. It's not suprised if you lagging if you put too much mod and a heavily scripted mission because the server or your pc calculating every script on air and sync it to every player so if the server have 40 player on it its like the server have 40 time load than regular one. Its logical i think but I hope BIS would improve their coding so we have a better fps on multiplayer.  Also if you even enter the forums.bistudio many people complaining about BIS didn't looking after problem that existed but focusing on adding new feature. Well there is some demand from player to fix some their basic feature I hope they listen to their community.   So overall verdict from me:  Graphics : 7.5/10 (gettings better) Sound : 8.5/10 (just like real life) Gameplay : 8/10 (just what I am into) Overall : 8/10 (recommended for you if you like gameplay like arma)10

Have over 1100 hours on record with this game since Early Access.  The game has become much more user friendly since coming out if you want a casual to all the way hardcore MILSIM experience look no further.  Pro's: Huge Scale  Gorgeous visuals  Large selection of weapons  Realistic Ballistics physics damage implementation for various calibers realistic Flight model including but not limited too advanced flight model implementation such as stalls vortex ring state damaged instrument panels and etc.  Welcoming community  Insane amount of free mods and maps (Including weapons textures sounds for weapons such as DragonFyre sound mod and etc..)  Tutorials that actually teach you how to play and how to not only react to contact and ambushes but also teaches you how to team play as part of a larger assault element and also combined arms (Ever wanted to be in the big boy army and participate in a large scale attack? look no further).  Good single Player Campaign.  Con's  Can still have a steep learning curve mission making takes practice more advanced missions scripting requires a decent concept of game script writing  Very very un-optimized for current Gen CPU's. Single thread performance only can be resource intensive recommend a i7 CPU for decent game play takes a beast of a rig to run with everything maxed out in multiplayer (FPS in multiplayer is based off server side FPS and NOT client side aka your PC FPS hence even powerful pc's can get stutter in large scale multiplayer games).  Can get pretty big in size if you subscribe to a large number of mods  Some mods can interfere with others.  TL:DR Since coming out  has become much easier to learn and grasp with new and improved tutorials and scenarios amazing mod support and close knit community help overcome and issues with this game such as optimization issues and map creation tools. . Been with you since Alpha and now Apex is coming. It's a great game really isn't much more to say. If you want a challenging time consuming and at the same time fun tactical shooter this is the game for you. If you expect CoD or BF go away right now.  Pros:  - Great mechanics - Huuuge detailed maps with so many towns cities and etc - Enjoyable vehicular combat and mechanics - Great (but cliche) single player campaign for a first person shooter - Fun multiplayer with unlimited gamemodes to download as mods - Eden Editor makes it fun to set up your own missions for training/fun - Great modding community  Cons:  - The engine should be replaced for the next title very unoptimized with huge frame drops even on good PCs. - The action menu needs to go seriously. - A bit of a pain to set up a joystick for fixed-wings/helicopters - Rain/storms could still look better happens you see patches of blue sky right above your head  For any tactical shooter fan out there this is a must have. But try to go into the game without comparing it to other FPS games. Just because it can be hard and has complex mechanics doesn't mean the game sucks10

his review will consist of both the famous Multiplayer as well as the amazing Single Player experience but first the old school rating standards:  Graphics: 7/10 Sound: 8/10 Voice Acting: 10/10 Content: 10/10  Learning Curve: Hard  ---------  Single Player:  No spoilers so read ahead.  has an amazing single player campaign that most  players do not even care about because they get right away sucked into the Multiplayer. Big mistake. Although the missions are extremely challenging even at regular/normal game settings the story line (for the people that are into lore etc) is amazing! I wish I could write more but I already warned of spoilers so I won't do it. All I can say is that it is fantastic the way it starts all the way to the way it ends. However new players be prepared for a difficult campaign. I recommend to play it on easy mode. On regular mode 1-2 shots and you are dead and enemies hit you from long range. The tutorial although well made still leaves to be desired for the very new players it just barely gets you the feeling of what it is you need to do. The voice acting is top notch something rare a real gem. Amazing voice acting with the right music at the right time. If you have  and have not played the Single Player Campaign you are doing it wrong!  Multi Player:  I mainly play King of the Hill Infantry only server. The MP is top notch too (it has its flaws more below). I chose the infantry and light armored vehicles only because all other server versions is mainly a BF/COD fanfest. You pull out an expensive vehicle and it gets blown up instantly once leaving the safe zone because aircraft have a much larger FOV and thus can easily take you down from long range. Yes it is supposed to be real but it is frustrating because the aircraft pilots are usually the more experienced guys and in the few King of the Hill servers it is always the same guys hour after hour farming transport choppers vehicles etc...Well it got on my nerves so I left to the infantry only servers. Great stuff here. Good team work less trolls/griefers and the community that runs the servers listen and help out dealing with abusive players. It is a great experience from long range sniping to being a grunt assaulting and holding a tower or riding people into the hot zone via a chopper there is plenty for you to do and to choose from. The ranking system is neat and does not take brutally long to get you started with the right modified weapon and cosmetic clothes. No zebra weapon skins or any of that none sense exists here. Maybe there are mods for it I don't know but here nobody cares how your weapon looks like.  The Map:  Altis and Stratis are real locations amazingly made. The only downside is that the interior of buildings are all empty but given the fact that apparently each house was placed there exactly as they exist today it is understandable. The Devs put a lot of work into it and I have been to Greece and yes it looks exactly like it. So do not expect to find a BestBuy Dennys or Jamba Juice there. All I can say is AMAZING huge map!  The Bad:  FPS is an issue. Sure it is no issue if you turn the graphics to low but I play on an i7 5960X with a 980Ti and this game is NOT playble at Ultra settings and even at high settings FPS can be horrible. I refuse to play this at medium settings thus I do get killed a lot due to FPS issues. There appears to be graphic related lag too from time to time. Lots of people will go on and on about end-user settings being the issue well I play a ton of other games that are much newer in ultra settings and no issues there. For people that want the above 60 FPS experience on their 27' 144 Hz screens this game is not for you unless you want to play it on medium to low settings. For my rig that is a no go so I play it at High settings and accept that I sometimes die because of FPS related lag. Also the weapon sound in terms of hearing enemy weapons (hearing own weapons etc is fine) is abysmal. A guy can shoot at you with a machine gun from 20 yards and all you hear is a soft 'tick tick tick'.... you need to download player mods apparently to make that better but I don't use mods so I am SOL I guess.  Game does sometimes have its bugs they do not occur often but they are there. You glitch through a wall at certain angles when you are inside a building and a sniper without AP bullets outside shoots your butt that is sticking out of the wall and you die these type of bugs. Easily avoided however.  Mods:  Speaking of mods. I don't play mods but that does not mean there are no good ones out there. There are a ton of mods single player multi player the skins of your country's army you name it it is all there.  Overall:  I rate this a 8.5 and as an old school player that to me means AMAZING. Got over 100 hours into it and looking forward for Apex next! The single player campaign is also present there and apparently it is affiliated with the one from . Looking forward to it !!!  To Conclude: Hard game to master but rewarding once you know the ins and outs of it! If you are into these type of games give it a try!10

is a well made next game in the Arma series with many options you can do. Now I played many different modes and mods that I should give you a decent review about this game.  Story  I do know that there are not many people that want to buy  because of the story but it still has one and isn\'t bad. It is a new story and does not have something to do with Arma 2 or else. The story starts with a mission for you and another soldier to help out another Camp but on you´re way there an invasion of the AFF starts over the hole Island and you and you´re superior that is with you at that time try to get to a safe place to reform their allies. This get´s harder than though because the AFF troops are anywhere but helpfully there were some units from the UK that helps out and you can regroup with them and so the story starts where you try to get connected to another safe Island and do many different tasks.  Gameplay   You can control land sea and air craft vehicles or go by you\'re own foot on the maps Stratis or Altis and many modded maps. There is not rally a task given to you by the game besides the story there are many different tasks given to you by community made co-op missions or PvP modes and also the complete different thing like a real life in modes like good known \'Altis Life\'. But besides Altis Life or other similar mods this is a military simulation game and give you many possibilities to let it feel like that. In co-op missions in a group of friends you need to make a briefing of the situation and make a plan or just go on patrol and get surprised by an attack of an opposite fraction and many more kind of situations. There are too many different gameplay methods given to you by the community that I can not listen them all up here.  Pros: -maybe one of the best military simulation games so far -many and sometimes comepletly different kind of gameplay methods -good graphics  -game gets upadatet by the developers to fix bugs and make the game just better -active community -Steam Achievements -you can use the terrain to your advantage  Neutral: -KI is okay as an enemy in co-op missions and is not completely stupid but also not perfect right now  Cons: -hard to remember all the keys for new beginners -many bugs(like falling trough some stairs and die or looking trough a wall) -the game has FPS problems like FPS drops   Conclusion: This game has many good things to offer and is one of the most realistic games so far (especially with mods) but it still needs to get patched and fix bugs.  is a game you should buy because of the game play you will not have in any game I know right now and you get to live with the bugs and learn to avoid them as much as possible and if you have friends to play with this game can get you many hours of fun game play to get.  10

ue to my  PC I did not play much of this game but let me tell you it is great. The game is a simulator not a normal shooter. The game only has 3 maps however they are huge. Bigger then the maps in GTA and the such.  I am not in the service so I do not know the specifics of combats however I was in ROTC which is owned by the US Army so I know a decent amout about formations and things of the sort.   You can salute. Saluting is exactly like it is in the United States Military. Your ring finger touches you eyebrow. Your hand should be canted at a 45 degree angle. Your elbow is also paraell with the marching surface.   The formations are also very realistic. Line Collum Wedge and Squad formations are done perfectly. Well the AI is kind of  and gets out of formation quick but they initially get into correct formation.   The guns sound horrible however they sound weak and nothing like the real counter parts. The standard issue weapon is not even a real weapon used by the military. However weapon balistics are spot on. Yes I even talked with my SAI in ROTC about this. The snipers has bullet drop that depends soley on distance and wind. This is not like battlefield which is static bullet drop. It actually depends of the weather and bullet drop is different for each sniper. Assualt rifes has reacoil and require precision to hit.  Overall if you want to realistic experience this is the way to go. This is a simulator however so don't go into this thing thinking it is going to be easy to learn because it is not.10

he first person shooter for those who dislike the far fetched things in games like call of duty and halo and who want the expansive enviroments that put battlefield to shame. While the Arma franchise prides its self on being a simulator it still has it's gimicks and comedic hickups be it some very interesting animations ragdolling or just physics occasionally breaking (  see here for example  [embed.gyazo.com]  ).   Don't be put off by that if you're looking for the ultimate military simulator however as when it works (which is does more often than not) arma offers some intense fighting with a range of weaponry and veichles. Arma allows you to operate ( with multiple people) veichles such as the standard civilian cars trucks and jeeps as well as the more traditional viechles seen in warfare games tanks APCs AA viehcles and artillery. Arma also offers a range of aircraft veichles ( be it more helicopters than jets) like the A-10 warthog bomber and the huron heavy lift chopper. Each veichle type follows its own set of physics which are relativley accurate to that of the real thing.  Weapons are o'plenty in  but I see little point in detailing every weapon in the game. In short theirs everything you'd expect to find soldiers armed with. The weapons in  offer different fire modes and caliber of round different calibers doing specific penetration and damage for example the 5.63mm Katibla rifle hardly scratches anything armored where as a well placed shot from the 12.7mm GMB Lynx sniper rifle can disable a chopper or jet.  there are a variety of game modes to suit your liking and mods if those are your thing. The three most common game modes you'll see on the server browser are     Wasteland    Altis life    Warfare  They are all distinctly different. Wasteland offers you a choice of 3 teams to join with preset load outs. You then scavange veichles and weapons from the veichles and attempt to do missions on the map to raise fun for better gear to wage war on other players. In short its sandbox survival. Some servers also include a base building function.  Altis life is something a lot of new players seem to enjoy both playing and watching people stream. Personally I hate it but thats just my opinion. Altis life is a role playing community that aims to represent some form of normality. Civilian players work to earn money and Police players enforce the laws. Civilians can make money through illicit activities as well as legal ones the illcit ones paying more. Each server is different so I won't go in to too much detail.  Warfare is what it says on the tin. 3 factions battling for contorl of strategic points across altis. OPFOR BLUFOR and Independant. These servers tend to be a lot more formal and require much more teamwork than the prior two baisically you have to know what you're doing on the game before venturing on to one of these servers as Armas combat system is like no other first person shooter.  I reccomend this game as something to play with friends and enjoy discovering it together as playing it alone (at least I find) is incredibly dull.  The dlc for this game is not essential to play on servers that have the dlc enabled. However you will not be able to pilot DLC viechles or use DLC weapons ( you can still enter DLC veichles as passangers) . In comparison to Arma 2 the DLC for  is very lackluster.  Currently  needs a pretty decent computer to run and even then you're likely not going to hit above 60fps. The game is very poorly optimized  My other fued with  is that manually dropping bombs from a jet is a task that is near impossible. The only way to drop unguided bombs is dive bomb. Using a strafe approach is difficult because the interface on the jets no matter what type they are is configured to that of a fighter jet.   These are all small disadvantages to a game that is so fun with friends  However due to the game only having two maps that are pretty similar it can get repetive very quickly  Over all I say 7/1010

column1: ve only played a little so let me tell you what I've experienced so far (please read all):   Gameplay: The gameplay is addicting rewarding and almost painfully realistic. You hear gunshots but don't see their source because the many trees rocks bushes buildings and obstacles are hiding them. The enemy NPCs are quite accurate and it takes a couple good shots in the chest to kill them.   Weapons Vehicles and More: The weapons look sick and the vehicles do too. One thing I did not like that much was that there seems to be no vehicle 3rd person view. I guess that can be easily overlooked. Weapons look really nice too. Clothing is a bit funny sometimes such as when I had shot someone wearing a bandana in the head- and they survived. Bandanas are terribly bulletproof somehow. The game is very specefic with everything. There are at least 5+ choices of: helmets night vision goggles rifles vests backpacks handguns scopes clothes artillery cars helicopters planes jets weird combat trucks boats and more.   Content: You get quite alot of content for the price of the game. EA charges $60 for an incomplete game- while ARMA III supplies you with more than a complete game. The MAPS ARE HUGE! (Yes there are two maps totalling in over 200 square km!)   Overall: This game is more than worth your money. BUY IT NOW if you enjoy FPS games- and can handle the challenge. You will die a LOT. I promise.10

I asked the community how to use and operate teamspeak as well as how to improve performance. he greatest military sandbox I have ever played  is a lovingly crafted game giving you an endless amount of scenerios to enjoy.   Singleplayer gives you the option to screw around with the editor and either create the insane or the epic. It's a challenge to learn but well worth it. The main campaign can be frustrating at times but overall is a very excellent experience. User-made content and scenerios add another layer of depth and Zeus gives an easy integration of that and multiplayer.    Multiplayer is by far the strongest point of the game giving an in-depth experience in many a situation. You can play it as a roleplayer joining Life servers. You can be a survivor of the wastes in Wasteland or you can join in many user-made situations. The greatest of the options however is proper team-based objective gameplay. With the right men squads can work together to accomplish tasks against insurmountable odds. It gives a very strong sense of satisfaction to be part of such a team and finishing the mission only solidifies that feeling.  If you want a very-well made military simulator offering wonderful graphics processor-melting situations teamwork tension and combined-warfare operation  is for you.10

t's vital to understand that this game is a platform. The things you can do in  vary substantially as you explore the well made campaign community made missions and popular pvp game modes. Without downloading any of the amazing free mods  has the potential to provide some of the greatest experiences of natural vicious combat possible in gaming. When played with a microphone with or without known friends teamwork effortlessly comes as you end up doing whatever you can to NOT DIE.   Because the game has so many options to play you may find yourself playing boring game modes or thrown together single player community made missions. This is why I'd like to recommend a couple ways for you to enjoy this astonishing. Creating or joining a group delving into medium to large scale COOP encounters is absolutely staggering. While some groups require entire application processes more casual ones exist that are still incredibly fun such as Reddit's /r/ProjectAwesome. If you just wanna jump in for a a couple hours instead of scheduling events a week in advance check out the ever present King of the Hill servers (preferably infantry only). Whatever you do USE A MIC and DON'T BE SHY! You get from this game what you put into it so interacting with others will enhance your enjoyment tremendously.  Once you find the way you like to play here I can promise despite its flaws that every facet of design will coalesce into a truly unique experience that will give you mind numbing moments you will never forget.10

is a game that focuses on realism without sacrificing all the fun. What you get with the game:  -Multiplayer. Many mods (or to be more accurate missions with scripts) are out there like Wasteland DayZ (the mod not the standalone game) CTI (Capture-the-Island which is like a Conquest mode from Battlefield with a huge map and ArmA gameplay) Domination (which is fairly similar only it's against AI). -'Competitive' Multiplayer. What this means is that you can experience the 'real' ArmA experience. What this means is joining up with clans and operating as a team as a real army would. This in my opinion is the definitive way to play ArmA3. Clans like this are things like  http://www.reacheliteforces.com/  . Look it up if interested. There are many clans out there just browse the Steamcommunity ArmA3 forums. -Like a dozen showcases which show and demonstrate the new features of ArmA3.  -Around a dozen challenges (firing drills) to where you can compete for a better time or train. -3 campaigns each around ~3-4 hours long (note: only one of them is out so far second campaign comes on Jan 21st.)  -Editor where you can do what the hell you want and can create your own missions or scenarios. -Steam Workshop missions! Download missions made by other players with a click and around two seconds and play them rate them. Hundreds of missions are on Steam Workshops plenty to choose from.   BE ADVICED HOWEVER: This game can be a pretty damn big machine hog. You need a pretty decent to PC to play this game appropriately even more so for the multiplayer.10

review for people new to ArmA:  A combat simulator with an immersive atmosphere and a flourishing community. Need I say more?  If you haven't played ArmA before it is certainly not your typical first person shooter. Instead of focusing on things like killstreaks and weird camos or attachments ArmA focuses on warfare as a whole. Heavy medium and light armor supporting units like weapons platoons and engineer teams clsoe air support of all shades is all addressed in ArmA with particular emphasis on how they are connected.  A level of authenticity is reached in ArmA that few other 'war games' can qiute match. Stamina and weight systems weapon sway and actual ballistics as well as movement intertia (I mean swinging an anti-material sniper rifle is going to have IMMENSE affect on a player's aim) all play into the authenticity ArmA brings to the table. Infantry roles are not simply reduced to four classes or a set of perks but are defined by their place in the squad and their role in combat.  Putting the game into words is not an easy task and taking my word for it is difficult for some. Watch Jester814 or Dyslexi on the YouTubes to get a full feel of what sets ArmA apart from other 'war games'. Let's just say this: Once I played ArmA I never went back to Battlefield Call of Duty or Counterstrike.10
