y mother would probably scorn me by saying this about any media related to war but...  This game is magnificent beautiful epic and brilliant. the sound-track is not too bad either! I absolutely love the way the game controls especially compared to the stiff nature of its predecessor Arma 2. This is particularly noticable when focusing on vehicles. In other words the vehicles handle like a dream due to the improved physics model (PhysX). apart from the third party physics engine implementation the engine seems to have seen new additions and reconfigurations such as the improved AI (still not perfect especially when driving). The textures are decent considering the scale of the game but definatly an improvement over Arma 2. Animations are miles better. The details of objects such as weapons vehicles and various common geometry scattered around the large expanse of the two vanilla maps (Stratis and Altis) are great!   I find great delight in oogling at such a realistic landscape which in the case of the vanilla maps apparently are modelled from real locations Agios Efstratios (Stratis) and Lemnos (Altis)! There is a lot of content on offer with  notably the ZEUS gamemode which is really exciting to play. Its when a player takes control of sort of an RTS perspective defending attacking and messing around with spawning objects and AI while other players run around as normal soldiers adapting to the unpredictability of ZEUS's actions. It's quite a fun game mode and no two sessions are the same. There are a load of other standard game modes along with the ability to play scenarios either made with the editor workshop or built in ones such as 'Escape from Altis' which is one of my favourite scenarios provided by BIS its great to play with some friends. In fact with a clan or a load of friends this game is a lot more fun. Don't get me wrong the Single player content which is similar is also really really good.   Speaking of the single player experience one of the most notable additions to this iteration of the series is the decent campaign. missions are good and diverse making use of the space it has to play with. As well as the good voice acting which seems to immerse me into the war torn greek islands of Stratis and Altis.  Despite all the good things in the game of course it has problems. One that sticks out like a sore thumb to me is the performace relative to the hardware. Also the fact that the game does not seem to spread the workload across all four of the cores my CPU has to offer
column2: The AI only take one thread causing servere framerate loss when trying to play with lots of troops running around. Which is what I enjoy doing in sandbox games like this most of the time. Servers seem to have problems too. As connecting to a friends has failed on multiple occasions seeming to be randomly stubborn towards other players joining your server despite inviting them.  This is no casual shooter. This is a military simulation. This is ARMA.....3.................puts glasses on gets up walks off into the distance.  &lt

DIT: I finally got into the modded server area of Arma3. I'm almost ashamed to say I put 7 hours into a Epoch mod+Ryan's Zombies and Demons server. It was a blast. Looting buildings building a sanctuary. Getting spotted by a zombie horde was terrifying all of a sudden you'd start hearing screams and moans and turn around and you see the zombies teeming out of a city. Crazy fun. Highly suggest Epoch or Exile to anyone looking for good servers to play.  My computer is definitely not up-to-par with running this on full graphics. Sometimes it makes engagements are 200+yards very hard especially with no magnification. But I still have had some of my best gaming experiences in this game. Find a group of guys. Find a clan a casual thing or just a server with the same people playing consistently. Your experiences in this game will skyrocket. I mainly play co-op servers just doing made up missions on the map against spawned AI. Its a blast. I've participated in missions that lasted 4 hours in real time and ingame spanned early morning to over night to the next morning. All because we encountered an APC and our AT guy was the first one shot by it in an open field. At night.  There are no limits to travel. If you want to run across the island feel free! It'll take you a couple hours I'd imagine real time I've never done it though. Everything is detailed towns have houses where you actually clear buildings opening doors and such. And tactics work. PvE is hard without a squad using comms let alone PvP.  For an epic military simulator you've got your dream game. Not for a COD fan just looking for a change of scenery. Its an entirely different FPS. You can do most things you would in real life. Pretty crazy.  Gameplay: 10/10 Optimization: 10/10 I can adjust my settings down and still get 50fps. Community: 8/10 a little hard to get involved but once you are amazing. Overall: 9.3/10 Get your friends to play with you.10

all of Duty? Battlefield? What are those? ArmA is a simulator game compared to those pesky arcade games. Nobody can 360 you here nobody can quickscope you either. This is the real MLG.   Try to go on a rush and see yourself getting shot. It's all about tactics how good your teamwork is and how efficient you play.  Pros *Unimaginably good UI. Game gets every command as I want to transfer. No problem. *Good netcode. Even with 200ms you hardly feel the lag. Most match lookups have no problem at all. *Stunning graphics. Yes it can use a better thing or two but it is a simulator game and gives you the simulating graphics too. Not to mention a large variety of adjustables for graphics. *Total realism. Okay well maybe except the magical first aid kits rest is pretty much correct. *Brilliant single player campaign. Unique for me. *Multiplayer with mod support. Let it be EPoch or Altis Life Zeus or whatever you can think of there's a mod related to military. *I can count these up to infinite but just get the game and see for yourself.  Cons *Bad low graphic performance. or I have a really ancient GPU. Ge-Force 610M gets ~30fps with everything at lowest 100% scaling with 768p. Drops down to 17-18 on really hammering areas. *Game's way too CPU intensive. I can go for a CPU stress test with this game. Maybe I should type this as a Pro. 2 in 1 program :P *Way too costly. 124TRY for vanilla version and 159TRY for Extended. Even with 50% discount it felt like it was a full priced game to me. If you're not fan of ArmA series or really want to get this game I can't recommend it without a discount. *A bit complex commands. Takes a few hours to get used to it hell it can even be days. Also not everyone can play this game. Takes a bit of extra buttons or few macros for quick responding to situations.  Go and do your thing private!10

column1: f your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place but if your looking for an outstanding lemon bars recipe you've come to the right place.  Ingredients: 1) 2 cups Flour 2) 1/2 cup Sugar 3) 1/4 teaspoon Salt 4) 2 sticks (1 Cup) Salted Butter Cut Into Small Cubes 5) Filling 6) 1-1/2 cup Sugar 7) 1/4 cup Flour 8) 4 whole Large Eggs 9) Zest And Juice Of 4 Medium-sized Lemons 10) Powdered Sugar For Sifting  Directions:  1. For the crust: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9-by-13-inch pan with butter.  2. Stir together the flour sugar and salt. Add the butter to the bowl and use a pastry cutter to cut it all together until the mixture resembles fine crumbs. Press into the prepared pan and bake until golden around the edges about 20 minutes.  3. For the filling: Stir together the sugar and flour. Crack in the eggs and whisk to combine. Add the lemon zest and juice and mix until combined. Pour over the crust and bake about 20 minutes.  4. Allow to cool in the fridge for a minimum of 2 hours then sift powdered sugar over the top before cutting into squares.  (Use an 8 x 10 pan if you'd like the layers to be a little thicker.)  This recipe has not been approved by the FDA10

rma is a great series of games and the scope of each title is always more impressive than it's predecessor. Yes like those it follows  has it's bugs but these are in no way irritating. At most they are hilarious.... because you become immersed with experience of being a lethal weapon methodically removing enemy AI from their short lived lives when all of a sudden the yells and laughs of comrades 'hoovering' in a tank or being insta-killed by randomly exploding vehicles that touched a small pebble breaks the cycle!   It's a game you have to try out. You can get into the game quite easily and add to your knowledge as you go. But don't be a lone wolf and complain it was boring. Arma is about team work... and not your Call of Duty or Battlefield TDM capture the flag balls...but actual teamwork where communication and learning your place in a squad keeps you all alive! The A.I. on this game is 'effective' - they will suppress they will surpise and they definetly do more than just flank you from obvious places. It's very dynamic and lonewolfs die quickly... a good squad will have a much higher survival rate!   So get yourself in a game be a local on the server and join in with 'regulars' to have the best experience.  There is a lot to learn but 's new tutorial system is far superior to older versions of the game and many of the players online are very helpful.   Heaps of content &amp

A 'tacticool' shooter. Sorry that was terrible.   is an apparent military simulator. I'd personally call it a casual simulator considering the bugs (the engine is riddled with them but the devs are active on fixing bugs and creating new ones in the process). There are issues such as: - The movement system (transitions can be jarring- a sprint can becoming a walk just because the terrain is *slightly* steeper which has got me killed more than a few times in the past though it can be solved by running in weird ways up hills) - Over zealous stamina system (60lb of equipment will drain your stamina whilst jogging in a few minutes 10lb will do so in a few seconds later) and issues like that. The guys I play with tend to disable it and for good reason. - 'Futuristic' theme through the use of various real world vehicles and weapons - no AKs M4/16s and countless other classic weapons we all know and love. Sucks in my opinion. - Really dumb ai. Some improvements over the ArmA 2 ai - ai reacts faster and better but can react a little... Overzealous. A single soldier in a good position can lock up squads by taking random shots preventing them from being ordered around (units love to crawl when under fire) requiring a lot of micromanaging as a squad leader - if you're playing as Zeus or using High Command for squads good luck.  There are many others but I can't think of them at the moment. But now for some good news.  You can install mods fixing a large number of gameplay related issues. Sadly the first issue with the movement system can't be fixed (or hasn't at least) but the stamina system has been fixed by a number of mods to be somewhat more realistic and more managable.  Mods such as RHS: Escalation (the US forces and Russian Armed Forces parts) plus the HLC packs solve the lack of modern weapons - the two mods / packs are my faviourites for this sort of thing.  Various realism mods around such as AGM and CSE also help improve the realism of the game.  DLC is also free with the game sort of. Similar to what they did in ArmA 2 you get the content but with some restrictions - so you can play with people who have it though you may not be able do access all the features and there may be some annoying notifications.

ersonal Rating: 9/10 Replayability: High Budget: Affordable - The price has dropped enough.  Length: It's mostly multiplayer - the singleplayer campaign is... Very difficult.   I was a fan of Operation Flashpoint - Dragon Rising and Red River as well as Arma II.  I have to admit the same problems that plagued Arma II still ravage Arma III to a degree.  It's unnecessarily difficult to set your keyboard up for this game.  They've certainly improved on it now the keyboard mapping recognizes double tapping a button and even holding it versus just pressing it.   That said a lot of things in this game could be handled through smart menus rather than having buttons for it.   It becomes impossible to remember where everything is toggled for.   That said the game is without a doubt the greatest military simulator I've ever seen and the AI is actually fairly smart (except for the friendly AI which appears to be stupid in comparison - but I mostly think it's because the friendly AI is subject to much more scripting than the enemy AI).   The inventory system is a welcome change from Arma II that had an incredibly complicated inventory system and the fact that you can change everything from your uniform to your weapon mods is super great!   The game is like I said very difficult in single player because the enemy can spot you before you can reasonably spot the enemy - but that isn't because the game is unrealistic it's because it's pretty difficult to spot an enemy on a 28 inch monitor in 1080p if there is a simulated distance of 500 meters between you and the enemy is wearing camuflage.  This game will probably be a good thing to try with occulous rift once it comes out. It doesn't help that the enemy soldiers use camuflage that is actually much better suited for the terrain you play in during the campaign - not that it matters the other way around because I don't think the AI is set to differentiate between camu patterns.   There is no melee combat in the game which was a bit of a bummer for me but I don't think you would ever get a chance to use it anyway because as I mentioned you will often end up spotted by an enemy long before you're even able to notice that combat has started around you.   The game lacks an easy mode where you stop to be wounded after bandaging your wounds and being out of combat for a while - Of course that wouldn't be realistic but it would still make the game a little less hardcore for those that find the difficulty a bit too steep.   In operation flashpoint when you reached a checkpoint your squad was revived wounds were healed and new squad members even spawned with full ammo.   In Arma III I find myself running out of ammo very quickly I'm only capable of carrying one rifle (an option to carry a rifle instead of a secondary weapon such as a rocket launcher would be welcome) and if I get hit at any point - It's going to affect the rest of the mission and missions are very very long.   This is a bit too brutal for my liking - it wouldn't matter in a multiplayer game but in a single player campaign where the missions are so long that I often feel like I could make a full time job out of playing the game it's too much.   That said you can't ask for a more realistic military infantry simulator. It very accurately represents what it feels like to be in the infantry.   The producers should have put in some optional missions that were skippable showing some of the less exciting parts of being in the armed forces such as building a camp weapon and gear maintenance dealing with a complicated and sometimes not 100% efficient chain of command and the many menial duties of being a soldier.   It'd be cool if there was a 'I'm military' mode that could be activated which results in you being assigned to a fire team in your unit instead of basically being a joker.   The AI in your unit does operate like a military unit with proper 'fire and movement' maneuvers but you're left out of this because the producer knew the player wasn't necessarily going to be able to keep up with that but some players have it the other way around they sit there confused wondering why you're not getting advancement orders why your team is acting like they have orders but they didn't reach you.   That said I think that it's GOOD that they did it like they did because this game is supposed to be for everyone and not just for people with military experience but it wouldn't have taken them that much longer to incorporate a mode like that.   With the verdict that sometimes the realism level in this game makes it TOO difficult to play through a limited interface such as keyboard+mouse and monitor then I can really recommend this game to anyone who likes military simulators.   It's not your average run of the mill FPS game though so if you like high-paced and less punishing gameplay I recommend something like battlefield instead.  10

his game is a different breed. For both the positives and negatives that brings with it this game is truly a different breed.  I can easily say the best times I've had playing a video game have been in this game. Those times don't come easy though and most videos don't do those times justice.  is full of quailty people but as it's seen significant growth also growing amounts of trolls and not-so-friendly players. If you can find a group of players with a similar mindset and enough talent you will have a fantastically unique time in this game.  Unlike most mainstream shooters this game is almost entirely community based. Sure  itself is controlled and developed by Bohemia but once you get in-game you are most likely playing a creation of another player. This completely opened ended sandbox of opportunities also has it's downsides though.  For one performance isn't top notch. The game doesn't perform horribly in most cases but a poorly scripted mission may lead to a drastic FPS decrease. Networked play will opperate fine under vanilla or well-created missions on a beefy server but adding in a lot of players and custom scripts will quickly lead to major annoying dsync.   The creative freedom in this game also means that expecting to launch the game join any open server and bunker down for some fun isn't a realistic expectation. A vast majority of the servers are community operated meaning there are some very good and very poor servers. Apart from the diversity in game modes (a positive element) many of the same game modes (or missions) are modified by their respective server owners. This could mean some extra goodies or some unexpectedly low FPS.  For all the negatives this game has the positive elements will easily and repeated lead me to highly recommend this game. Just know what you're signing up for before purchasing

have seen some negative reviews on this game and they mostly say this:  - Bad FPS in multiplayer - I don't understand the controls - A lot of bugs - I have a high end rig and it's still bad FPS - There are DLC add popups in the game  Everyone needs to understand that comparing Arma to CoD or BF is like comparing Windows/Android to Mac/iOS. Windows is made to work with a lot of different software made by a lot of different parties and therefore sometimes buggy. In the same way Arma is made with modders in mind. Whenever you join a server it is a 98% likelyhood that the server is running on mods. In some of these the FPS can be sub par I'll admit. However that is because you are playing with software (mods) that is made by players as yourself and they are doing this for free. Time spent on optimizations are therefore not always enough to give you high FPS. And remember ALL mods are free. If you join a server without mods the FPS is at 70-90 compared to 25-45 at heavily modded servers. Don't get me wrong though a lot ot modders have done a great job with optimizations to get modded servers up to 90+ FPS.  As for the controls yes there are a lot of them. Why? Because this game is at heart a foundation for a military simulator. If you only had BF/CoD controls at hand 70% of the functions in the game would have been gone. Learning the controls is tricky but also very rewarding.  The last thing I wonna say is that Bohemia Interactive is the most community friendly game developer I know of. They listen to the community they give credit to modders and their way of implementing DLCs should be the standard of the industry. A lot of negative reviews complain about adds in the game. That is because when Bohemia releases a DLC it usually conains a lot of functions for free (Shooting from vehicles better projectile trajectories etc). What you actually pay for is the new weapons and vehicles in each DLC. They are somewhat abundant as there is thousands of weapons and vehicles made by modders so paying for the DLC is more about contributing to Bohemia rather than buying new weapons. And let me say the adds only pops up when you use DLC weapons and vehicles in-game if you haven't purchased the DLC yet. Which means that there is no upbreaking of the community because of DLCs.  If you like the BF and CoD franchises wonderful I do too. If you wan't something a bit less arcade try Arma. It's a beautiful game and you really get hundreds of games in one.   You like zombie survival? Buy Arma it's got it. You like survival without zombies? Buy Arma it's got it. You like teambased infantry? Buy Arma it's got it. You like all out mechanized warfare? Buy Arma it's got it. You like WW2 shooters? Buy Arma it's got it. You like Vietnam era shooters? Buy Arma it's got it. You like Star Wars? Buy Arma it's got it. You like life simulators? Buy Arma it's got it. You like playing BF and CoD? Buy Arma it's got it.  10

fter putting in over 800 hours into this game's predecessor Monster Hunter 4 Ultimate this game plays with the gameplay mechanics a bit while still retaining the good feel of victory after each hunt.   Like the other games in the series the main gameplay focuses around your character hunting monsters with the key focus of avoiding their attacks and attacking at opportune moments between their attacks often times hitting their weak points for massive damage. And like every game in the series you can't heal and attack super quickly
column2: you need to get out of the way of an incoming attack and heal then continue avoiding attacks until the opportune moment to strike.  There's a smaller weapon variety in this game but each weapon is still unique in how it plays as how you attack with each weapon slightly differs so I'm glad they retained that feature. Another feature that's also in this game is the limited inventory space so you have to manage your inventory as you progress
column3: you can't hold everything after all.  One thing I'm sort of iffy about is the limited hunter rank
column4: in the previous game it was 999 but in this game it's only 20. This makes it much easier to cap your rank and it doesn't feel as rewarding but the grind it takes to get there is a lot quicker so I guess that's a plus.  Perhaps the best part of the entire franchise is that the main 'large monsters' get their own battle theme and this game is no exception providing intense battle music for the two flagship boss monsters as well as the usual recurring map theme for regular hunts.   One mechanic that I abused greatly seemed to have been removed until the final boss and that is the popular tactic known as sleep bombing
column5: towards endgame you're given the only weapon with the sleeping status effect. Nothing quite satisfies like putting the monster to sleep then destroying it with one devastating unseen strike to finish it off.  All in all this game plays quite differently than the other Monster Hunter games but still retains many of its core features and that's why I recommend it. It has significantly less content than the other Monster Hunter games but it's also significantly cheaper so it balances out nicely.  Uh Not too sure what to write here so here's a recipe for Pancakes instead  Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour 3 tablespoons sugar 1 tablespoon baking powder 1/4 teaspoon salt 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground nutmeg 2 large eggs at room temperature 1 1/4 cups milk at room temperature 1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract 3 tablespoons unsalted butter plus more as needed  Now to make it 1. In a large bowl whisk together the flour sugar baking powder salt and nutmeg. 2. In another bowl beat the eggs and then whisk in the milk and vanilla. 3. Melt the butter in a large cast iron skillet or griddle over medium heat. 4. Whisk the butter into the milk mixture. Add the wet ingredients to the flour mixture and whisk until a thick batter is just formed 5. Keeping the skillet at medium heat ladle about 1/4 cup of the batter onto the skillet to make a pancake. Make 1 or 2 more pancakes taking care to keep them evenly spaced apart. Cook until bubbles break the surface of the pancakes and the undersides are golden brown about 2 minutes. Flip with a spatula and cook about 1 minute more on the second side. Serve immediately or transfer to a platter and cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Repeat with the remaining batter adding more butter to the skillet as needed. 6. Procedure for adding fruit to pancakes: Once the bubbles break the surface of the pancakes scatter the surface with sliced or diced fruit or chocolate chips nuts etc. Flip with a spatula and cook for 1 minute more being careful not to burn toppings. :)10

is a sandbox military game which excels in a number of ways. The way the game encourages community-play and user modification is unprecedented. I'll briefly summarize a couple pros and cons.  PROS:   Infinitely customizable. With the in-built editor and SQF scripting language you can make any scenario you can think of.   Thriving modding community. With small mods that change minor gameplay aspects to complete overhauls like CUP and RHS there is an incredible amount of community built content for you to enjoy.   Variety of scenarios. If you want to be a lone wolf in a zombie apocolypse or just a standard rifleman in a huge coordinated operation there are scenarios and groups for you.   CONS:   Almost requires DLC. You can play the game purely vanilla but most servers and communites you find will require at least Apex if not everything else.   Steep learning curve. Being a game with incredible movement controls these controls all require keybinds that need to be learned on top of potentially learning to fly planes and helicopters this could take a while.   In summary  can cost a bit and take a large amount of hard drive space but is extremely rewarding to learn and find a group of people to play with.11

his game is frustrating it's dowright infuriating at times.  And I absolutely love it.  Oh it has a steep learning curve. It's a big hill to climb before you learn all the controls then get used to the somewhat bizarre controls (especially if you're coming at it from other FPS's). And the pace is very different from your CoDs and Battlefields and whatnot.  But this isn't trying to be those games. It is not a shooter it's a simulation. And it's the best one there is.  - It's a true sandbox game. From the campaign to the multiplayer. And there's nothing like it out there.   - The standard map Altis is a replica of the real-world island of Lemnos. And me and my mates love it so much we're saving up to go there on holiday.  - You can do whatever you please. The scouting missions in singleplayer let you explore the map and do missions the multiplayer opens up the entire map and lets you do whatever.  - Bohemia are absolute darlings and are doing a fantastic job. Have been for years. The community is beautiful from the players to the modders.   Oh and one of the devs got arrested for 'espionage' while visiting the island for research. That's how committed these people are.   TL

is by far my favorite game to date considering it's Realism Graphics Features and of course all the Mods that add on to the nearly endless amount of things you can do with the Base Game's Eden Editor and Zeus mode.  The only thing i can say that 'may' frustrate some is the learning curve but with the Virtual Reality Training Simulator it will teach you all you really need to know from Compensating bullet drop to Crash Landing a helicopter if you're Rotor is damaged. (However the Learning Curve is what makes Arma well Arma)  Aside from that i must say that the game always stays fun and HELLA CHAOTIC (especially in online multiplayer) because this is not just someone shooting at you from a distance or calling in an artillery strike with some binocluars. There is a  across the ridge who spotted you and is calling out the compass bearings to reveal your position so his buddies can light your  up or he is calling out your exact coodinates (or your Grid) so that some  in an artillery truck miles away can nail your position exactly. So when  goes down in this game  GOES DOWN.   The maps on this game by the way are absolutely massive Atlis clocking in at about 250 sq km Stratis at 20 sq km and Tanoa (the new DLC map) 100 sq km. All consisting of different terrain from A large hill country feel in Stratis more flat land in Atlis but strongly representing a wartorn country and Tanoa having a very dense Jungle terrain with many islands to be explored and its very own guerilla faction and Nato (Pacific) and CSAT (Pacific).  Vehicles in this game feel VERY real opposed from most other games. Tanks will have a Commander Seat Driver Seat Gunner Seat and Passenger seats (all having their own role) and goes the same for most other vehicles such as a jet fighter or a helicopter where you will most likely have a Co-Pilot or multiple gunners. Controls are a bit more tedious but allow for much more control and flexibility on most vehicles.  All in all  is by far my favorite game to date and im sure it will stay that way for a long time the devs keep up to date with patch updates and bug fixes and the community is always active and consistently putting out new mods. 3 years after Release the graphics still amaze me and the game itself always stays fresh.  10/10 would crash land a helicopter in the jungle to be chased and killed by guerilla fighters again.10

love the Arma series.  definitely my favorite in the series by far it has so much detail in it and it's extremely community friendly. The game isn't just a MilSim it's also a Zombie survival game a kart racing game an RTS game a role-playing game and much much more. The massive multiplayer online community for this game has thrived off of it's community created and endorsed custom multiplayer modes like classic  DayZ Altis Life Wasteland or even Battle Royale. There's plenty of servers to join and plenty of gamemodes to try. All of them have their own unique kinks and features to make it a completely unique experience from the base game. There's even a massively in-depth editor mode in which you can create your own singleplayer or multiplayer scenarios using all the assets in the game ranging from soldiers to scuba-submarines. With tonnes of script functionality implemented into the game the editor truly is an endless pool of opportunities. The game as a whole is amazingly worth the base price itself but if you can grab it on sale (especially the Winter or Summer sale) then it's an absolute steal. The only thing to look out for when purchasing this game are the minimum requirements. It takes a pretty good PC to run this game so make sure you have a proper set up before you invest into this game other than that it's fantastic and I highly reccomend it to anyone that enjoys any kind of First Person Shooter experience.10

do recommend this game but there is something that you need to know about this game.... This game is not the most optimized game out there your PC might struggle like hell. You can enjoy this game if your PC specs meet the requirement even so you might face FPS drop during gameplay (explosion etc.). This game is CPU intensive if you experience FPS drop there's a chance it is caused by your CPU (unless you set the graphics all the way to high then your GPU might be the case too).  This is a military simulation game if you like games like Call of Duty (and used to it) you might not like this game however if you want to try something new then this game is worth a shot. This game has limited HUD there is no minimap and if somebody is shooting you will not be given a hint and you will need to find the source yourself. You will be given a compass to help you to locate yourself and to give other people hints about the location of the enemy. Every single bullet counts I mean 1-3 shots can kill somebody do not spray and pray. You will not be given a hint about your location so you need to be observant and check your surrounding.  One big problem about this game is.... There is no melee so you can't kill other players with a knife it can be a huge turn off for some people (I am one of those people) nevertheless it is less likely that you will use melee in the game it is most likely a gunfight.  If you want a shooter game and want to spice things up then  could be the game for you if you are still unsure then you can check some YouTube videos and see it for yourself. This game is hard the control buttons are many (I highly recommend newcomers to go to the tutorial first) before going into the campaign or multiplayer.  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- My PC specs can be seen in my profile just to let you know how well this game run at least in this setup. I can play this game in Ultra settings.10

mulation isn't the defining aspect of . It's scale.  The enormity of the map is the foundation for the experiences that distinguish Bohemia Interactive's flagship franchise. It's what makes radios topographical maps binoculars and compasses practical equipment in an FPS. It's what allows for kilometer-long headshots and coordinated convoy raids. It's what makes using your eyes to spot hints of enemies muzzle flashes tracers and gunsmoke.   represents an aesthetic overhaul of the series. Unbelievable dynamic lighting a volumetric cloud system genuine vehicle physics 3D weapon optics ragdoll noticeably improved weapon audio and other grainy eye-level details await scrutiny inside 's macro elegance. The best improvement is the merciful cutting of Arma 2's rigid Tin-Man-without-oil combat animations which makes infantry combat more responsive in your hands.  A half-year in paid pre-release has given  time to gestate but the final build is far from being a comprehensive reinvention of the series and some long-standing blemishes that arise from its nature as a gargantuan simulation linger. Even on high-end hardware the framerate dips under the spectacle of some multiplayer missions. Friendly AI units though marginally better-behaved still depend on the player to be their brains an issue that's circumvented by playing Arma the way God intended it cooperatively.10

his game is a dream come true for me! This is probably the most realistic combat simulator I have ever played! Being able to play on real photo accurate locations is really fun and awesome especially when you take the vast size of the maps into consideration! My favorite part of this game are the 2D and 3D editor tools that are provided with the game it allows you to create just about any scenario you can think of! Have you ever wanted to experience a stealth night operation as a scuba diver and wipe out patrols? Or have you ever wanted to experience a full on war with combined operations such as hundreds of ground units armored vehicles and aircraft? OR have you ever wanted to design a fortress that you and your AI team has to defend from hundreds of invading enemies? Well all of this and much MUCH more is possible with the easy to use editor tools!  Also I have come to the conclusion that 's AI is the most advanced versitile and smartest AI than any other game has to offer I was extremely surprised when I hand-placed a bunch of jets in an airbase to see the AI know how to actually taxi the jets to the runway strip and take off in an orderly fashion without running into each other or other obstacles during the whole process!! Also I didn't even place any waypoints or create any scripts for them it was all the AI!!! The AI can adapt to pretty much any situation and will follow orders from you if you are the leader of the group. Plus it is really fun to watch independent AI squads battle it out without your interactions the AI squad leaders will actually command their units (even you if you are part of their squad!) in any situation!  The multiplayer is very fun you can play in a variety of servers that could involve capturing territories fighting AI role playing combined operations with over a hundreds of players or all of the above combined!!  Lastly this is more of a thank you towards Bohemia Interactive: As someone who strongly supports the United States Military and has 3 brothers in the Army I thank you for your bold brave and admirable move to not include female soldiers in this game I understand that society is trying to move in that 'accepting' 'politically correct' and 'equality' direction but this whole movement is proving to be VERY troublesome and problematic for the United States Military. Ask any American male soldier who has actually fought in combat overseas what they think of allowing female soldiers fight by their sides they will ALL say that it is not good and that they rather keep females off the battlefields. Unfortunately American society doesn't understand the fact that females naturally do not have the capability of controlling their emotions under stressful and dangerous situations as well as males can. There have been MANY recorded events that involve female soldiers putting their battle partners in grave danger during combat situations due to letting their emotions control them. I understand that this is just a video game but it still does matter A LOT what developers do with their games because you would be really surprised how many young men and women go to enlist for the military just because of movies or video games honestly it is really quite sad.  So thank you Bohemia Interactive for making such a good game you guys are making excellent bold moves which I believe sets a great example of how other developers should operate and not fall into the common traps set by society. Thank you!  James Glenn10

f you've ever wanted to play a game where you'll never be able to see who's shooting you because they're half a kilometer away then this is for you. I can't mention how frusterated this game has made me yet I seem to always come back. I come back because while this game is very difficult and very confusing for new players it's also very rewarding. Once you get the hang of the controls (which there a ridiculous amount of that can glady be rebinded) you'll feel amazing that you finally blew that  that kept sniping you across the maps head off. Thats not the only thing that I love about this game. It has a huge amount of customizability. There are so many cool well done mods out there that you can pretty much do whatever you want. You can even put models and textures from the Halo game series in here.  also has a community that is relativily active that welcomes anyone to play. I haven't encountered one  on here since I've been playing. Its all just good fun. Now the only negatives that I can think of is the developers aren't very keen on good content. Some of the DLC is questionable and probably should just be free updates or already in the game. Otherwise this is a really great game.10

HIS IS A COMBAT SIMULATOR NOT AN FPS! I cannot stress that enough. Having said that some of my most memorable gaming moments came from this game. I can remember moving through a town we were so close to the objective then an explosion. A guy in my squad had stepped on a mine then came another and one more after. The enemy opened fire and we had to dive for cover. My squad quickly attempted to return fire but it seemed we were pinned and there were three of my buddies still laying wouded in the open. Unsure of their condition I charged forward grabbing the first guy and pulling him behind cover then the second and soon after the third. Miraculously I wasn't hit by gunfire but we had problem our medic was one of the three wounded. Without a field medic to stabilize the wounded they would surely die. I called out over the comms for anyone who could help there was a long pause...then a response a pilot just happened to be dropping off a squad nearby and was happy to evac them to HQ. We eventually managed to drive the enemy off allowing for medevac to pick up the wounded and fly them to safety.    It still sounds to me like something that would be scripted in a singleplayer campaign something where you are surrounded by npcs and you are merely along for the ride just for entertainment. The truth is these were all real players fighting as a team trying to save three members of their squad. It's player interactions like that that make this game incredible.  TLDR: This game is awesome I cannot reccomend it enough!10

will say so far as a military simulator i enjoy this game alot speacially when you have a team of friends to play it with. i will post the pro and cons that i believe to be in my opinion it is up to you to either purchase the game and make you own opinion.  Pros: - Very good variation of weapons vehicles and attires. - The Damage system for rifleshandguns are well-balanced eventhough unrealistic. - Graphics and animation are very well improved from the previous Game (Arma 2) - weapon physics are somewhat realistic it includes bullet drop as range increase and it make it simple for those people who use weaponS IRL to understand how the physics work  Cons: - The ridicoulus price currently on not only the game but as well the DLC content. Not worth purchasing DLCs  unless its on sale. - This game is a high intense on the CPU of your system and unfortunatly  not a lot can be done even if you reduce your display settings. - some vehicles are to OP or their ranges are unrealistic to the real world models that they mimic. - Server provider pretty much need to either get their stuff together or just give up because the latency  gets really bad eventhough i access a server located in my state.  So far this is my review with time i might change it with time but for the mean time i will say this game is worth getting if you have multiple friends that play it often.10

RMA. The most respected Mil-Sim series to date. Serious play that's the objective.  'Fun' isn't a word I would use. It's not casual you simply can't hop in play 15 minutes and then hop out. The enjoyment comes from finding a server and getting to know people. Playing with them when you take on hour long missions that's the enjoyment.  First thing I have to say really which I almost forgot about IT'S REAL SCALE. The 'maps' really should be called environments. You can't drive from one side of the island to another in minutes. The battlefield is really a battlefield. While most modern games focus on a small segment of a city town or something ARMA is about the openess making you sniper bait. You have to look hard for hostiles they could be shooting at you from a hill across the valley.  Performance. Was it terrible the first few days after release. Even still AI seem to cause a drop in FPS even though they are far away. This isn't latency this is pure frame for frame output. Never really understood how something unoptimized got pushed out. That being said they follow Valve's ideas and push out updates for free.  I play with a GTX 560Ti and Core i7 870. CPU matters GPU matters. i3 wasn't up for the task even with a 4GHz clock. You need an i7 or 8-core AMD heat monster to play with details. If you can push your rig you get to see things that many don't get to see.  N00bs will have a large hill to climb in regards to learning the game.  7/1010

ost realistic war / military game ever. The game is very easy to mod and the community has ended up making some very fun gamemodes and a variety of mods. Some of my favorite custom gamemodes are 'Altis Life' and 'King of the Hill'. This game also has a ton of realism units / milsim units that do custom missions. Even though this game has been out for three years it is still being worked on with new updates maps etc. The map 'Tanoa' is expected to come out sometime this year and they just released the 'Eden 3D Editor' a couple days ago.   Overall this game is amazing. With the surplus of mods and gamemodes this game never gets old. If you are interested in buying this game you will need a good computer to run it. Some servers have custom veichles and other things that drops your FPS low. Also this isn't like most games where you can just go play for 15 or 30 minutes. For gamemodes like 'Altis Life' I usually set aside 3-5 hours to play. But I'd give this game a 10/10 for the realism and the easy access to mods.10

was actually one of the first people to pre-order this game's Supporter Edition on March 5th 2013 and so far the game evolved from a 7-8/10 military shooter with emphasis on realism to a 12/10 Military Simulator the probably best mod support of any game currently on the market and an extensive community that happily accepts new players.   If you're searching for realistic military operations in a videogame ArmA is for you. If you're searching for some open world roleplaying or general TVT action ArmA is for you. If you would like to be part of a group that conducts CO-OP and/or TVT missions together ArmA is for you.  Additionally one very huge part of this game is the mod support literally anything you can imagine ranging from fictional spaceships to realistically modeled Main Battle Tanks as well as all accompanying features can be downloaded and used in game just a few mods I would recommend checking out:  JSRS 3 Dragonfyre the successor to the very popular JSRS2 for ArmA3 and the previous JSRS for ArmA2 this soundmod delivers a high fidelity realism oriented sound environment I would strongly recommend checking out a few videos on the official JSRS studio's youtube channel if you didn't know that it's a mod for a videogame you would probably think that the sounds are part of actual combat footage that's the fidelity you can expect from JSRS.  Blastcore Phoenix JSRS is for sounds Blastcore Phoenix is for visuals Blastcore Phoenix which is also currently in developement is the successor of the very popular Blastcore mods for ArmA2 and ArmA3 this mod delivers realistic high quality explosion and smoke effects while still maintaining good ingame performance if you want to check this mod out make sure that you're specificially searching for Blastcore Phoenix as the new mod is quite a lot different from the old ones.   RHS Escalation this mod is actually split up into two mods and has been released only a couple of days ago it brings very high quality contemporary Russian and American assets into the game including vehicles weapons and uniforms despite the mod being in a very early stage at version 0.30 it already has considerably more content than the main game this mod is definitely worth being checked out.  Authentic Gameplay Modification this mod could be regarded as the successor for the Advanced Combat Environment 1 and 2 modifications for ArmA2 they take this game from being somewhat beginner friendly and while already very realistic to a Simulation that may be mistaken with VBS the military training simulator developed by a sub company of Bohemia Interactive this mod may not be for everyone but if you're looking for the most realistic military experience that can be delivered by a game this mod is definitely worth checking out  Advanced Combat Radio Environment or Task Force Arrowhead Radio these two mods which actually could be considered rivals provide the game with very realistic communication in form of an overhauled VON and simulated real world radio models they also come with a very high fidelity UI they achieve all this by using a teamspeak plugin.  The TL:DR of this would be: Should you get ArmA? Yes.11

is a game you'll either love or hate and personally I love it. Sure the game is a bit confronting at first as it looks like it has a million controls (pro-tip: If you're mostly sticking to infantry combat you'll only have a handful more buttons and button combinations to learn than the most shooters E.G. Battlefield) and the game definitely feels clunky when compared to other FPS games out there (though it's come a long way over the years) but in a way that adds to part of it's charm once you get past that. Small things such as having multiple shooting stances meaning if you're near a hole in the wall you can raise or lower your body until you're at a level that allows you to use that hole to engage through makes a huge difference into how combat plays out in this game compared to others on the market. You'll want a beefy PC moreso in the CPU department than the GPU to get the most out of the game and a lower end computer can be a bit of a hinderance in PvP (E.G. you may be unable to see your shots landing at long range) but for PvE this won't be as much of an issue.   The game has a wide range of multiplayer game types and anyone should be able to find something to accomodate them. There's King of the Hill battles akin to Battlefield Life servers that are sort of a mix between The Sims and GTA Online Invade and Annex servers (Players fighting AI to take back towns) so on so forth. There's also a huge community of players who make custom missions be it a coop adventure or an organised PvP battle there's more arcade orientated units and groups who focus on making combat as realistic as possible. There's also a huge amount of mods and community addons for the game from missions uniforms vehicles weapons realistic functioning radio plugin so on so forth. One need only look and you should be able to find something you want both in terms of content and community.   is definitely a game worth picking up if you like realistic combat a sense of community and/or a huge range of community added content.10

y Quick review.   is probably the most user friendly entry into the series. Not to the mention the best looking and in my opinion the most fun to play.  Now thats not to say doesn't have issues. CURRENTLY not as much content as the previous entries but that said BIS is working on more and its soon to come. Obviously the modder community is working feverishly away.  Steam workshop support for missions is great and as soon as they add support for full Mods everything will be even better.  The game plays as one would expect. Its a tactical simulator so that means the average expericance wont be a firefight every few seconds. Tehre is waiting there is walking but if you're of the right mindset it all adds to the experience and build up. Knowing only a few shots can kill you make it quite tense.  Key points- -The new stance system is great a variable height and lean means you can make the most out of any cover you find yourself in! - The maps are huge and varied with the scenario editor you can quickly whip up any type of engagement you want. - The game is better multiplayer if your more of a Solo player I wouldn't say you'll have no fun but I think it'd be more limited. - So many mods on the horizon all will add up to be the experience you want tailored to you.  So all that said I love this game. Devs are continuining support with regular updates and additions. Join a multiplayer community and prepare to have a blast!10

et's see... I have put 530 hours on ArmA II and 230 on ArmA III... Is this a good game?  Yes.  It is a military shooter that focuses on scale. There is some realism and some not its a video game so of course there will be reality breaking moments.  Do the sounds of rifles crack? Yes. Grenades that explode near you will shake you up and be loud. The sounds in this game are amazing. From the hum of the chopper as it starts up to the rumble of your tank you will feel like you are in this breathing world of military hardware the moment the game starts up.  The graphics are amazing. There are times when I simply stare off into the horizon in awe at how large the map is. You can customize your character for a more immersive feel in game.  There are mods and various game modes. From Deathmatch to King of the Hill and DayZ Epoch there is something for every FPS fan.  The gameplay mechanics and controls are deep. Be ready for about 8 different key strokes for how you can take cover but it works in its favor as you want to have the most concealed firing position yet be able to hit your target so peeking around corners from low to the ground rocks and more make combat from mountains or Close Quarters dynamic and fresh. Piloting a heli or driving a tank is easy to pick up and rewarding when you master it. For airplanes you may find the controls difficult as having a stick is the best and easiest way to effectively pilot (some players only pilot and use only the joystick in multiplayer).  There are really cool workshop game modes you can download and play solo or with friends.  10/10 I highly recommend this game due to its gameplay controls and graphics. If you enjoyed the ArmA series you will love this game and if you like military shooters with some realism you will also enjoy picking this game up.10

n contrast to the popular genre first person shooters  lives up to being a war simulator. What makes this game so successful is the contribitions made by the community. Like well source games  Garry's Mod  being one of them 's Steam Workshop is full of user-created content that continue to enhance gameplay to this day.  While being as realistic the game was made enjoyable. This can be a drawback as the first-aid kit continues to be the cliche for quickly restoring health and the artificial intelligence are strong at some points and weak in others. To be fair this is not a medical simulator and the AI are not to be operated by super computers.  With the upcoming  Apex DLC  in sight it is extremely recommended NOT to just get the  base game. Even if the multiplayer is currently dominated by Altis-Life Wasteland and King of the Hill that is likely to change when Apex is released. It was announced that many new enjoyable features would be implemented in the DLC in favor of those who would much rather prefer a simulator for war than a simulator for life on Altis or for an apocalypse.  Previously this game was losing their veterans and gaining rp'ers and fp shooters. If your playstyle fits in the three don't worry. Bohemia Interactive see's what their players are into and is doing their part to equally make content for those who prefer different playstyles.10

his is one of the most complicated FPS games to play as in there are a lot of control you need to learn to make your character move around in a organized way. Once you learn them however the games becomes very fun and difficult. So if you dont like a challenge this game is not for you. Some parts of the campaign I had to try (on regular) at least 20-30 times. Im a decent FPS player but is like no other I've played.   The game itself is very nice to look at albeit not as optimized as I would like to see. It is also very heavility CPU based. My OC 4790k hovers around 20-50% usage sometimes going into the high 60s. I play on very high at 5760x1080 and get around 55-70 fps on average with 970 SLI.   The gameplay is very different then any other game. The audio and realism is very good. Sometimes you really think you are a soldier and get scared when you are walking and suddenly hear bullet impacts near you. The gunplay is also very hard and challenging. You have to really be slow and careful on where you are how you plan to engage the enemy. Because they are very good shots and you die very easily. So you have to be strategic in everything you do. Which can be really fun.   This also is not a non-stop action game. There is a lot of walking and exploring. This is like a COD polar opposite.   Mods and custom content really add to the replayability and fun of this game. The fun never stops when you have all of the steam workshop and a few friends to play with.   Some things did bother me and broke the realism for me. One being that a nice combat simulator like this with accurate gun behaviors and recoil doesnt even have 2 different reload animations for guns or when reloading when not empty you don't get 30+1. Also there is not very good animation in this game reload talking and some player animation is not very smooth or realistic in many cases.   Overall I give it a 8/10 for what it was planning/supposed to be and how I received it.10

column2: Build your own missions (scenarios). Yes you can build your own missions once and if you get bored of the main campaign or you finish it. You can either get Scenario mods Campaign mods Vehicle and Unit mods or Game changing mods which mean they will put you through another Era in time and you can either download scenarios or campaigns with these mods. Examples of these are : Iron Front 3 for Arma and Unsung vietnam. You can grab IFA3 here on the steam workshop however you will have to do some searching for Unsung it can be found on MODDB. Last but not least is Multiplayer. Now i have not played very much of the multiplayer becasue in my opinion to really get the most out of multiplayer you should play it with friends. Now that is not to say don't play multiplayer because you dont have anyone to play it with but communication is key in some game modes. parachute into a hot zone. I hear the distant crackle of small arms fire. Kind of like fireworks. 4th of July... I snap out of it as the ground suddenly rushes up and meets me. I roll onto my stomach and crawl into a nearby bush. I jumped with 3 squad mates. Where are they? I glance around. One comes drifting down dead in his harness. The other is nowhere to be found. Tension builds in my belly as the chatter of nearby automatic weapons fire starts back up again. I gaze cautiously out into the outcropping of squat buildings ahead.   Is that where the fire is coming from? I can't tell. Can't be sure.  I am frozen.   There is a house across the street. The street is narrow. I could dash for it. But it might blow my cover. 50 meters never looked so far in my life. I get into a crouch. Glance around again. Suddenly I see smoke rising from a dusting of rocks to my left. I immidiately drop down and toss a grenade. It works the enemy tango dashes from the rocks. A few swift pops and he's down. Was he alone?   There was no way to know for sure.   This is warfare. This is Arma.10

is a solid military simulator that really gets its legs from the modding community. Many ppl are familar with the ARMA series for one reason alone and that is the DayZ mod it's even a well known fact that the game ARMA 2 sold more copies shortly after DayZ was released than it had since it's initial release. Not having played much single player besides a few short training sessions this review is going to be mostly focused on the multiplayer mods gameplay and engine in general.  First of all I want to say that this game may not be for those with underpowered PCs ESPECIALLY IF YOU ARE PLAYING MULTIPLAYER. While the engine performance is dramaticly improved over ARMA 2 unfortunently it seems that in multiplayer performance will suffer especially with high player counts due to a combination of server performance (running an ARMA server is very resource heavy especially cpu) and netcode shortcommings. The graphics have been improved over its predecessor as well as performance allowing for even greater view distances than I was able to pull off in ARMA 2 while still having playable framerates. Lighting in my opinion seems to have been improved the most leading to many atmospheric moments when I would find myself taking a screenshot. Models have all been improved quite a bit with the character models receiving the greatest leap in graphic fidelity I can almost feel the stubble on the manly mans face sitting next to me in the attack chopper its the future I tell you.  As you would expect in a military simulator there is a huge variety of boom sticks and vehicles to play with and not having a knowledge of military equipment or really a lot of experience with ARMA 2 I won't go into what guns/vehicles are new or what is more or less realistic. The gun and vehicle models however have seen a fantastic improvement in overall texture detail and resolution and the animations in general are a giant improvement over previous ARMA games with many of them appearing to be motion capped for that sexy smoothness.  Gameplay has shown improvement in equal lengths with my favorite additions being the character stance positions revamped inventory system and much more natural feeling to movement in general. This is partly due to the fact that animations in general have been improved but also because mouse acceleration and smoothing seem to have been fixed. Combat feels solid and realistic the effects and sounds of warfare do well to set the mood and convince you that you are really blowing the  out of someone or really in the .   The positional audio is fantastic and you can tell the approximate distance of gunshots based on their volume and trust me the sound of a gunshot travels a long long ways. I also want to mention your characters sound effects visual effects and ambient animations I love these and they really pull me into the experience. I have been walking for nearly 30min and I have finally made it to the cocaine fields but someone saw me comming. Oblivious I stand collecting the leaves when I hear something and my heart sinks the rustling of feet and whispers in the bushes. I panic and turn the way I came bursting into a full sprint as I hear sirens begin to blare out and helicopter blades begin to spin. I'm sprinting at full speed now and the edges of my vision blur as I run blindly into the darkness. I'm breathing more heavily now and my vision is more tunneled than before the color seems to have melted away slightly and I can't focus my eyes. Still running I'm breathing so heavy now that I gasp for air at times nearly choking on the air i'm attempting to breathe. The sirens are now far off in the distance and the whirling blades of the helicopter have nearly left ear shot I gasp for more air as I slowly regain a normal rate of breathing. I wipe my brow to remove the sweat and my vision finally clears I can see the boat I rode in on still there waiting for me I feel much better now. It's these little details that make an experience like that feel personal and real this was an experience I had playing the mod 'Altis Life'. Everything in the right situation really comes together to bring you into the game experience and this is somthing  has pulled off well.   Now the mods are where I think ARMA really shines as they provide infinite replayability assuming the community continues to develop for the platform. So far I have to say I am very impressed with the creativity of the mods and the scope of the mods in general. Want to recreate a historical engagement maybe survive the zombie apocalypse or perhaps selling fish and smoking weed is more your gig? You can do it all with the vast array of mods already available but I want to talk quickly about my new favorite mod Altis Life. Altis life is a roleplaying mod were you must choose whether you are a civillian or a cop and you must live out you life however you choose. Civs must make a living whether legal or illegal it's you choice and your options are vast for how you do so. The cops must keep the civs in line and enforce the laws if you are running around smoking weed and yelling F*ck the police you are probably gonna get pulled over beaten and arrested. Play it cool and do the speed limit maybe you will get away with that trunk full of heroin and get rich quick. Or maybe you just want to pick peaches smoke your weed and claim its for medical purposes when the cops pull you over its your choice and it is really great fun.  There is so much more to say about this game and the potential it has with the fantastic modding community but I've written too much here already and i'm tired so i'm going to bed. On second thought maybe ill just do one more run to the poppy fields.10

pdated review: I have been exploring more features of  and I love it!   I have been playing a bit of the standard  features which are fun but the sheer number of mods and workshop missions is unreal! This game is so flexible.  My most favourite mods and missions I have been playing are:  Altis life: think along the lines of GTA but everyone ever where is a real player the police military bandits civilians criminals everyone. It is a very immersive mission where you do what you want whenever you want. Earn money through doing legal jobs or become a criminal and traffic drugs rob banks rob other players do whatever you want to survive but beware your actions could get you on the police wanted list. Buy food weapons vehicles licenses and so much more it is a great experience when your on an active server.  Escape Altis: an online coop game which can also be played single player your goal to escape the huge island of altis. You will encounter AI enemy`s in all kinds of locations choose how you get through stealthy? Or guns blazing? Do it your way! This mission is very challenging and lots of fun best with mates!  Breaking Point: Think Dayz but on a bigger map less glitches and now a choice of 5 factions to choose from. Each with their own perks rules (or none depending which you choose) and appearance. Breaking point provides 5 maps Altis Stratis Thirsk summer and Thirsk winter.  The thirsk maps are PvP orientated with survival thrown in for good measure.  Stratis is bigger than than Thirsk maps with a bigger focus on survival against zombies and other players. Altis is just huge!  While breaking point is still in its infancy the dev team is working really hard at it and adding new features and maps frequently. Vehicles in this mod are fairly rare so expect work to be done finding them you will also have to fix them up to get them working to.  I love the  engine it is so flexible and allows for so many different ways to play it just never gets dull.  I highly recommend it!10

his is one of the most interesting and expansive games out there. The current storyline and background is a bit unrealistic-The Republic of Altis and Stratis has a super-advanced military but the nation has under 50000 people in its population. The population also is Greek but for whatever reason all speaks english-even the armed forces. Nonetheless the mission editing is superb compared to Arma 2 the mechanics are mostly improved (animation and AI needing a bit of a change for realism) the voice acting for British and American English as well as Farsi is superb. Iran has a huge presence in the game however it is never mentioned and instead goes under the quite unrealistic banner of Canton-Protocol Strategic Alliance Treaty or CSAT. I really wish that BIS would at least include the Iran flag above the CSAT insignia on the uniforms for it looked absolutely amazing when this was the case at E3 2011. Physics in the game are great however the fabled ragdoll physics are a bit dissapointing. All they seem to do is make units die in a more unrealistic-looking way. NATO is portrayed as completely bankrupt which really bothers me-unemployment is at freaking 50% in the US. It is interesting to see future interpretations of the US Army which use the new multicam pattern in their uniforms. I am bothered by the lack of ANY yes ANY authentic equipment in the game. This is perhaps my biggest problem for it gives the developers an excuse to make fantasy content for every upcoming Arma game. Yes it saves on lisencing but the developers just launched a 650-thousand dollar modding contest. A fraction of the money could have been spent on making the weapons and vehicles authentic.   With a host of friends to play with some mods and an open mind this title is one of the most awesome games I have ever played. The simulation of the vehicles is amazing with support for almost every joystick controller or other external device you can think of. The game fails to provide an immersive atmosphere but is a fun and engaging way to play COOP with friends strategy being completely necessary. The graphics are in my top 10 games ever and the performance is better than with Arma 2 especially if you plan on making Youtube videos like I do. (check out my Youtube channel: FistoGames :D ) Go and buy it. With some DLC's that bring it back to where Arma 2 was in scenario it will definitely be an amazing game.        10

am 30 years old and started this series with Operation Flashpoint in 2001. As a result I am playing ARMA (and predecessors) half of my life.  It has a tough learning curve but if you embrace the gameplay and are willing to learn all the different aspects of the game it will reward you with the most realistic and unique gameplay across all games.  The game itself is basically a sandbox which is already great fun but adding the different mods it is so much more. If you are into fast pace action I recomment 'King of the Hill by SA-Matra'. Do you want to be a resistant leader with the aim of cleaning the bloody opressors from your island: Play 'Antistasi'. Do you want to have some survival action: 'Wasteland' or 'Epoch'. You enjoyed the movie 'The Hunger Games' and want to play sth alike: 'Battle Royal' is your mod. Last year they added the ZEUS which lets a player to be like a role play master who has a 3d editor to script a mission spawn enemies or friendlies directly on the fly while your players fight against what ever you throw at them.  The awesome community of Arma created countless missions (more then 20k) which range from small modifications to complete overhauls.  If I would need to pick one game for the rest of my life: This is it!10

h the good ol' Arma III. Lets get started.  Arma a mil-sim game by Bohemia how is it played? Custom game modes. Yes there's a campaign yes you can do the mil-sim related tasks and wage war against other mil-sim players but this game isn't typically played like that. Custom maps like: Altis Life King of the Hill Battle Royale Mod etc are how most people end up playing and enjoying this game.  As of this writing I play this game for the most part once or twice a week but as you can see I've logged hundreds of hours on this game. That should speak quite a bit in regards to the fun factor. Whether you want to Role-Play with other players (who 50/50 just shoot anyways) play a giant game of king of the hill with big guns and vehicles or just play an hour long survival last man standing kind of game... Arma III offers it.  Downsides to this game bugs lots of them expensive DLC and one of the most poorly optimized games I've ever played. The game would greatly benefit from a way more optimized engine that doesn't tank a modern PC under 60FPS by just being in a town.   Once again that said you can spend hundreds of hours entertaining yourself in the world that is Arma and I do highly reccomend this game for all shooter fans.10

ell I only have 100 hours on this one. But that's enaugh after I've played nearly 2000 hours of ArmA 2 OA with and without the DayZ mod.(440 or so hours wasteland 220 hours on a single dayz server and about 150 - 200 on multiple other DayZ epoch servers via DayZ commander) The game is simply improved it runs better than the old one does (at least on my system) looks great is less clunky. The game is set in future (I dislike this bit) Is a time cow as alaways. To newcomers this game takes time. There are no quick 10 minute rounds. The meat of the game for me is on 120 people wasteland servers where it takes time to get gear takes time to travel takes time to siege and objective and so on. An average paly session will last from 2 hours and up (If you want to acctualy acomplish something).   10/10 would recomend if you can run it.   Howerver I'd simply suggest picking up ArmA 2 when it's avalible for 5 or less euros since the price is quite steep when not on sale and you're either going to love this (like I do) or hate it.   It's not comparable to Battlefield or Call of Duty. And even more so it's false to think that liking any of those games will make you like ArmA as well.  Also when deciding on making your purchase take a good hard look will you be able to run this game and if can play a game on 30 fps. I'm all PC master race guy with atleast full HD and 60fps as a requirment however without the latest and greatest rig it's hard to swim around 60fps in this title. SP runs well very well even but when it comes to MP your expierence is close to unpredictable. On some servers you'll be running great and on some you'll have 10fps no matter what you do.   This game is uniqe. It's more like tools and materials that can be used to create a beautifull house than the house itself. his game is definitely a direct improvement over Arma 2. If you are familiar with that game it is very easy to transition over to this game. I especially enjoy the mission editor. The mission editor has a pretty steep learning curve but enough tutorials and trial and error will get you competent with the editor's logic. The game is much better optimized than Arma 2 was but it still runs pretty awful on multiplayer even with a high spec PC. I ended up having to turn down my view distance to a pretty low amount to consistently get 40 fps on multiplayer because the fps largely relies on the server's power. On single player or a small server of 5-10 people I could just about max out the game with a steady 60 fps. I am disappointed with the DLC though as it really doesn't add much at all to the game at this point and it retails at $25. I would recommend picking this game up even if you have never played the other Arma games because it seems like it has a much smaller learning curve than previous titles but is still just as in-depth. This game is a good purchase especially on sale the DLC on the other hand is not currently worth it.10

ROS: -Great game with tons of mods and gamemodes -The community is huge and there is always going to be players -Graphics are simply beautiful  CONS: -Game is unoptimized  -Game may initially be overwhelming to newcomers of the series. -Lack of more in-depth audio options may be a turnoff for us 7.1 surround users or those who just want a greater level of control.  MY REVIEW  Your experience and mileage may vary depending on what you do with . You can go all vanilla and play campaign or simple multiplayer or you can go with the huge modding community. The mods are really what make this game great. Not in the mood for simple deathmatch? Play king of the hill with 120 players! Not in the mood for that? Try Epoch or Survival!   The gameplay is solid and the experience is worth it. There is only one con and it may affect you depending on how you like to experience games.   You are more than likely not going to get 60 FPS in this game and probably will be hard to get a solid 30 without the occasional dips. This game is highly unoptimized on multiplayer. The game runs fine with single player campaign but with multiplayer the netcode is completely weird. Some mods i can get 60 FPS in some i can barely hit 30. Regardless if i run on ultra or minimum settings you will only usually have the same FPS the server has. This was a BIG problem initially then i just got past it. The gameplay more than makes up for it and the experience is more about the community. Hopefully this will be rectified soon however i highly doubt it especially if you look at DayZ.  Audio customization is a problem i have in particular also. With all the customization  allows with the interface they barely have any settings for audio. Mostly just the general 'Master' 'Chat' etc. I wish i could choose which sounds' levels i could adjust.   I bought this game with the intention of playing EPOCH since DayZ' latest update ruined everything i liked about the game and in the end i barely play EPOCH. Mostly Survival and King of the Hill. Great gametypes and i also highly recommend ATLIS Life.  In 's current state i would rate it a 7/10.10

remember seeing screenshots of Arma 1 and thinking 'Wow this game must keep me entertained for months' but after obtaining it I quickly changed my mind and thought what a buggy piece of crap this is me being a somewhat casual gamer back then. The game was a total disaster to me and made me think 'How could they even call this a game?' The best part were the voice commands. Move. To. That. Building. At.. SIX O'CLOCK! Not to mention the game ran like crap. (Only arma players know what crap means.) (This was obviously ~6 years ago so I was a bit younger then aswell)  Well I had a friend in xFire who I shared a similar fate with but for some reason we decided to try it out together anyway. What we did was the sample Seize the area -mission that you can automatically create from the editor. Suddenly the game wasn't so bad after all. Everything that it lacked in the usual things you have in FPS games it gained back in gameplay and the complexity of the game. Suddenly the trademark buggyness and clumsyness of the engine (which is still present) was a feature instead of a problem. We played it for about 60 hours straight after that downloading mods missions and whatnot.  Then came Arma 2. Being a moneyless kid I was I couldn't buy it. So we tried different cracks playing through hamachi LAN with the same CD-Key and whatnot but got beaten by the anti-crack software it had built in. Now you might think that's cause of our amateurism but really it was cause nobody played the game back then and nobody could create working cracks. Literally there was maybe 1000 players around the world who had bought the game. Eventually I managed to buy the game and spent countless hours on it until it was time to put it on the shelf.  And then maybe two years later came DayZ and probably a million more players cause of it.  Suddenly there were keygens cracks.. - whatever you needed to bypass the protection. Also the mainstream gamer had found out what kind of possibilites the Arma engine can provide (dayz being the example). This was something the game developers deserved for putting so much effort to the series.  And now cause of this success  is here. It's basically Arma 1 and 2 with a bigger budget. I wouldn't have ever thought during my Arma 1 days that it would ever get this popular.   What  features: - Excellent graphics - The most realistic military simulation there is - Huge map - Good modability: This has always been a strong point in the series just check Armaholic and steam workshop and you'll find all sorts of things for your liking. - Possibility to design scenarios with endless different ways: Want a mission where you have to sneak through enemy lines and assasinate an officer? You got it. - Excellent co-op gameplay. - Trademark clumsyness to a lot of things which will become a feature once you get used to it.  But.. if you're a codfag
